Reviews.Title: “Charming Lovely Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plan2gosoon
Reviews.Content: Myself and my cousin stayed in this hotel for 6 nights this past week and loved it. It was lovely. I will attach a few pictures. I don't know the layout of the other rooms but ours had two twin beds, close to each other, but made separately and we did not feel like we were "sleeping in the same bed". It also had a recessed desk and chair, small round table with two chairs, a recessed wardrobe, extra pillows and blankets, two small night stands with lamps, a phone, a decent sized bathroom (watch that step into the tub, it is a big one), good water pressure, and hair dryer. Each day we had fresh towels and they supplied soap, shampoo and little glove type wash cloths. The wall paper was floral and we loved it. Our window (no screens of course) opened to the courtyard which was a wonderful cobblestone area with plantings of beautiful azaleas, primroses and other flowers, and tables and chairs. The hotel was actually two buildings. The registration area was in the other building, the same as the breakfast room. We had interactions with at least 4 different front desk people plus the breakfast room lady. They were all friendly, helpful and gracious. We only had breakfast there one day as we were out and about so much. It cost 9 euros each and consisted of half a baguette, a croissant (both large), a pot of hot coffee, a pot of warm milk and butter and jam. It was delicious. Our room was 135 euros a night. We could have found something less expensive I am sure but this place was so charming I am glad we stayed there. The only downside IF you want to be picky is that the walls are thin but who cares. The area is chock full of restaurants and little shops. It is close to Rue Mouffetard, the Pantheon, Rue Des Ecoles. The metro stop was a long block away. We only took the metro 3 times (to Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur, and to get to the RER for Versailles). It was very easy to get to the Seine and all the popular spots. The hotel had wi fi so I used my phone to check email and skype back home. We were going to print our boarding passes for the return trip (someone was helping us) but the site didn't work. Fortunately, there was an internet place around the corner that was very reasonable so we used that instead. I recommend this place. Loved it. I didn't rate it excellent because it seems I do so in most of my reviews. In reality it was excellent. Also, no TV - HOORAY!! It was also secure.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Explr7
Reviews.Content: We do not speak French, but the staff here was so patient and friendly with my family. They were so thoughtful and polite, and we had so many questions during our first trip to Paris. It was easy to navigate from this location, and many sights were within walking distance. The room felt like an antique, cozy cottage, but had lots of room. We loved the feeling that we were staying at a comfortable b&b, and rooms are spotless. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: FreedomGirl57
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in Paris. From the cosy and attractive French decor, the lovely cobbled courtyard and garden, to the friendly service, everything is just how we pictured it. Well done to all the staff and owners who have got it just right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BeJeTravelers
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my wife along with another couple stayed here in early October 2011. Our hotel room was very comfortable room along with a very nice bathroom. We were greeted by the owner and given some information which we found to be very helpful. The hotel has a very nice dining room, which offered breakfast at an extra charge. Our room had a nice grandma, elegant feel. The hotel is located in a very nice neighborhood, with plenty of restaurants, bars, cafes, and everyday essentials. Easy walking distance to the Cardinal Lemoine metro stop, and about a 15 minute walk to the Seine River and Notre Dame Cathedral. The hotel has a very nice courtyard with tables and chairs, and the hotel will provide you with glasses so you can enjoy your own bottle of wine, bread, and cheese. We had breakfast everyday at a little bakery around the corner on a square. Delicious pasteries. I would stay stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TCorrigan
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood for those who are literary buffs. Hotel is across the street from The Hemingways first apartment and a few doors up from one of James Joyce's homes. it is a charming place with warm, helpful management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Place To Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SallieBriz
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris once or twice a year for work and always add a day or so on for pleasure. This is where I always stay; it’s my favourite place to stay in Paris. I’ve been to Paris every year for the past 10 years and during this time, have tried many hotels and stopped when I found Hotel Grandes Ecoles I will be back again in May and would never stay anywhere else now I found this little bit of French Paradise in Paris! I’ve suggested this hotel/ B & B to everyone I know who is visiting Paris. Its like your own little home in Paris, you don’t feel as though you are staying in a hotel. The property is gated, once you enter you walk onto the gorgeous cobbled stone entrance way all the way up to the reception, the property has gardens, outside seating area and breakfast room (personally I simply walk out down the road to the local patisserie for breakfast). The rooms are extremely clean ( generally if you stay in a charming hotel, charming is another word for rundown and smelly!) well presented, can be a little small depending what room you get ( however this is the norm in Paris), the rooms have lovely old world decor and oozes charm. The owners are delightful and very helpful. Very close to the Metro, Pantheon and great restaurants is only a minute walk away. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to experience Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GoodYellowLabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early November 2008 and plan to go back next year. We have a room with two twins (#239) and it also fit a third bed for the 4 nights that my son joined us. Marie was lovely and helped with everything we needed. It's a short one-block downhill walk to the Metro (uphill coming back!). Several great small restaurants, bakeries, etc., within a block or so. Our room had both a shower and bathtub combo, making both of us happy. It was a very modern bathroom. There is a lift (elevator) in the building we stayed in. We never got to use the patio area due to the rain, but it would be lovely in better weather. Breakfast was nice, close, and served american-size cups of coffee! The entire place was clean and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Cozy and cheap for Paris”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaLivermore
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here in June (me, my husband and 2 boys ages 4 and 6). We had a room with one queen bed and fold out double. While the room was a little tight for all our bodies and luggage, it was comfortable and clean. The location is up a little hill from the Metro stops, easy 1-3 block walk. The circle nearby has some pricey restaurants, and a nice little grocery. I only had the breakfast at the hotel once, but it was lovely and the staff was so friendly and helpful. I booked the room nearly 6 months in advance, it is such a good deal I am sure it books up fast. The interior courtyard area is very pretty, although the pictures are a little misleading, it is up a little slant and the actual seating area is pretty small and very well shaded.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: facepalm10
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellently priced, cosy and clean, honest and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: mybellMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Found this one on Tripadvisor and was so so happy! It was my partner & my last night in France and when we arrived at this hotel we wished we had more time! Our room was off the courtyard and it was spacious enough - I even had a bath! We were walking distance to the river and was a good base to explore the left bank. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again, and look forward to doing so!

Reviews.Title: “Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jimgsumner
Reviews.Content: Terrific location and atmosphere. Rooms are basic. Nice courtyard with tables. Staff is awesome. Only a ten minute walk to Notre Dame. 3 min to the metro station. Make reservations as soon as they will take them for your dates, approx 4 months in advance. This is a popular spot and fills up fast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: yellowsteph
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles for 4 nights in mid-October. Given all the good reviews, I thought I would see if there were any rooms available. I was only requesting the room a month in advance, so I was very surprised to find they did have room, especially when people advised in their reviews to book far in advance. Location: The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter/5th Arr., which is full of restaurants, shops, and narrow streets very full of Parisian style and charm which are great for wandering. Very close to several metro stops, and only a short walk (15 min) to Notre Dame. The hotel itself sits in a beautiful, quiet garden courtyard just off one of the main roads. The courtyard is locked at night, but guests have an electronic key which gains them access to and from the hotel anytime. The Rooms: Our room was just perfect. Just what we needed and very clean. We stayed on the 3rd floor; our room was accessible via either a small spiral staircase or small lift/elevator. We had a window which could be opened to let in the crisp autumn air, as well as the faint sounds of people practicing piano and violin in nearby quarters. The decor of the room was very French Provincial and fitting. Our furniture consisted of: one double bed (which was comfortable enough), table & chairs, nightstands, and wardrobe/armoire. We also had a full bath, which was very nice. We couldn't seem to get the provided hairdryer to work, but we didn't contact anyone in the hotel for help, as we didn't end up really needing to use it. I'm sure if we had contacted Marie at the desk--or any other employee--this issue would have been addressed (which probably would have ended up being user-error, no doubt...) :o) The size of the room was adequate, and comparable to any other room I've stayed in in Paris. The walls did seem a little thin at times, when late one evening a gentleman was knocking on the door of the room next to ours (while calling out to the person inside), and we could've sworn he was knocking on our door. But this was really the only time we noticed the thin walls. Thin walls, though, are very common in most Parisian hotels (at least where I've stayed). We did not notice an air conditioner, which wasn't an issue for us being that it was a cool October, but the heat (especially on the 3rd floor) may be bothersome in a summertime-stay at this hotel. Staff: Everyone working at the hotel was very pleasant and patient with us. We communicated in French as far as it would go, and where our French ended, they gladly communicated with us in English. Everyone was very accommodating, answering our questions and offering travel/sight-seeing advice to us when we asked. They did offer breakfast (coffee, juice, croissants & breads) which cost 9 euros per person per day. We found that the nearby restaurants offered about the same thing for the same price, and this is the option we chose, as we liked being out eating at the restaurants and people-watching. The hotel would have been a fine option for breakfast, though. Other Guests: To be honest, most of the guests staying at the hotel that we saw were American, and most guests seemed to be of retirement age, although we did see one family with a couple of adolescents. I'm sure the guests vary depending on when you stay here, but it did seem to have a quieter feel, perhaps related to the guests that typically stay here? It is definitely not a "party scene," but guests seem to be very nice and quietly sociable. I think it would be a great place for my parents to stay if they visit Paris. And I will definitely stay here again when I come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the good reviews!”
Reviews.Content: The reviews are correct. If you want to feel like "not just another tourist", stay here! Our party consisted of 2 couples who stayed here twice during a tour of France - once in Sept. and once in Oct. 2011. Everything you read is true. It IS like staying with friends in the countryside. There is even a laundry a few steps away, with a cafe next door to sit and watch the world go by as you wait for the laundry machines to finish. At the front desk, Marie can answer ANY question you have. Let her arrange your shuttle van to the airport and you won't be sorry-except that you will not want to be leaving so soon. No question that we would stay here again. We learned where everything in Paris is in relation to our "home" here. We walked a lot and rode the Metro, which is a block or two away. Many bottles of wine, baguettes and cheese were consumed in the courtyard while meeting and greeting other guests (all of whom seemed to be English speaking and had great ideas of things to do and see) Don't miss this! PS take it seriously when they say you can't reserve until a certain date...Marie means it! But get that phone call or email to her early on the date you can reserve, or you will miss out. This place is deservedly popular.

Reviews.Title: “A TOUCH OF THE FRENCH COUNTRYSIDE IN THE MIDDLE OF PARIS”
Reviews.Author: MayLehmannNYC
Reviews.Content: Four years ago we stayed at the Grandes Ecoles and experienced such a wonderful two weeks that when we wished to return to Paris in 2011, we decided to stay there again. I’m happy to report that though the Euro seems to have gained ground on the Dollar, the hotel is still a bargain, and if you can reserve a room in advance, I don’t think you’ll be disappointed. Hidden behind a huge gate just down the street from where Hemingway lived during the period in which he wrote “A Moveable Feast,” you enter a short cobbled pathway lined with flowering plants and shrubs that seem to herald what is around the corner: three beautiful 3-story buildings that could easily have been moved from the French countryside. It’s location, a short walk to the Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens, Il St. Louie and Notre Dame, could not be more centrally located. And being situated off the Rue de Cardinal Lemoine, its peaceful countryside solitude is a welcome respite from noisy tourist attractions and crowded museums. The outdoor area landscaped with tables and chairs encourages you to dine al fresco in good weather or sit for a late afternoon snack while writing postcards or reading a book. Though the rooms do not come with “frig bars” the management does allow you to bring your own food and drinks to their tables and will even offer additional beverages if requested. The individual rooms of which I have sampled 2, are more than comfortable with private baths, suitable lighting, flowered wallpaper, and fans if needed during the warm summer months. The absence of a TV was in my estimation a huge plus as I was there on vacation to relax, not necessarily to be distracted by headline news or dubbed films. However, the real plus to this magical hide-a-way later became evident when first we checked in, and later had breakfast. At the front desk was the most engaging and helpful Marie who happily juggled questions regarding museums, taxis, tickets, weather, train service, you name it, she had an answer. She managed it all through an extraordinarily cheerful disposition. And starting your day off with a bang was Dorota who managed to stand out in a stellar line up of women who alternated serving breakfast. If I could have bottled her enthusiasm for life, I would have happily tried to get it through customs, but instead, I just wallowed in her energy which was the perfect way to begin each new day in Paris. The only down side is getting that reservation, as the hotel is extremely popular and provides a time-line from which you can phone or email your initial request. That said, I do think it’s worth it to leave yourself a “pop up reminder” on your computer: It’s time to contact The Grandes Ecoles!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Awesome! awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan0172
Reviews.Content: What an amazing gem in Paris! This hotel was recommended by a friend of ours and it did not disappoint! The front desk staff were friendly and helpful... Even didn't mind when we checked out an hour late... We had room #32 which was right off the lovely courtyard and was so cute! It was spacious, clean, and had a huge bathroom with a tub! There was a courtyard for people to sit and enjoy a bottle of wine and socialize!! The location was great and I felt totally safe and had no problem walking around at midnight. Lots of great places to eat and a hope, skip, and a jump from the metro, pantheon, and notre dame. The only downside was we wished we could stay longer!! Would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Decorated & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lilvtchic
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed for a night at Hotel des Ecoles and will definitely be back again! Very closely located to a metro line and about a ten minutes walk to the Notre Dame, you can't beat the value! While the room wasn't overly large, it was plenty big and included a nice sized, comfy bed. In Paris its very hard to find a hotel that isn't too loud yet within walking distance to the city but we felt we got the best of both worlds with our room. Our room, #108, was located in the back of the building so that might have helped cut down on the noise factor. Since there is no air conditioning (and it was quite warm and humid during our stay) you will have to open the windows, but there were mostly trees behind us so we weren't concerned with privacy or noise with them open. Again, the bathroom wasn't huge, but the shower was big enough and had plenty of hot water! My only problem with the room was a lack of a mirror. While there was one in the bathroom, it was small and it didn't allow me to see my outfit. There was a nice courtyard outside the hotel where people can eat their cheese, drink their wine, and enjoy a nice afternoon or evening. I also liked that they had a big gate at the entrance for security and it helped me to sleep better at night. The receptionist spoke English pretty well even if she didn't go out of her way to offer us any tourist information. We didn't have the breakfast but there is a cafe located just across from the metro stop that has amazing pastries and breads at a good price. Next time we are in Paris this will definitely be our first choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oasis in a calm, pretty quartier of Paris; a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Emily0384
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in August, and I couldn't have asked for better. It is, first of all, perfectly situated: across the river from the big touristy things, in a quiet area with a whole street of delicious food shops just around the corner (try the gelato on the square... Amorino, I believe). It is an easy walk downhill to the Cardinal Lemoine métro stop, or an easy walk across the river to the Île-Saint-Louis (home of Berthillon ice cream, making it a great walk!), and across the river again to the other bank, or up to the Île de la Cité. The hotel is immersed in beautiful gardens; walk through the huge door on the street and you enter a paradise in the middle of Paris. The rooms are charmingly decorated and comfortalbe, and so reasonably priced for a room 1) in Paris and 2) in such a gorgeous hotel in such a perfect part of Paris. All the staff are super friendly and say hello whenever you walk by, and are more than happy to help with anything and everything! There are some books downstairs (a book exchange, I think) and maps of Paris, etc. etc. etc. Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Paris a weekend to remember”
Reviews.Author: PhilRSmith
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have never been to Paris and picked out this hotel to stay because the area sounded great. The area was bustling but quiet with many cheap and varied places to eat and at nights the place became alive. The hotels staff were kind and friendly, even to us non french speaking Austaliains> They were very helpful in trying to give directions, to all things local to do and see. The room we enjoyed was very comfortable, clean and quiet. it helped that the hotel was located in it's own little courtyard off the main street. All in all I would recomend this to any couple or family wanting to see Paris. Located close to the Sorbonne and the Pantheon in the latin quarter. We walked to most places and were only a 10 minute stroll through the shopping areas to the river Siene, Notre Dame and the Louvre. All in all a long weekend to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Jeanette stays at Hôtel des Grandes Ecoles”
Reviews.Author: FaithfulTraveller
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller I stayed 11 nights at Hôtel des Grandes Ecoles the first two weeks of September, 2011. Adding my voice to others, I sing my praises for this lovely, busy but quiet, peaceful and very safe hotel, perfect in so many ways: central and convenient location in Paris, room and bathroom spotless, fresh and spacious, abundant hot water, clear and free drainage of tub and washbasin, bed very comfortable, sheets snow white, crisp and cool, blankets warm and snugly, bed pillows inviting, towels absorbent and large. I enjoyed their most delicious continental breakfast. My room was beautifully decorated, I felt like I was a guest at someone's house in the country. From two large windows I had a view of the gorgeous garden and when these were open there was a cool breeze coming in; I could hear the birds chirping, the owls hooting, the leaves rustling in the trees outside and at a distance the ringing of church bells. With the windows closed, it was all quiet. To add to all this glory, all the staff was very courteous, friendly and helpful. I felt each contact with them was full of warmth and kindness A shuttle service was made available to me when It was time to catch my flight at CDG. What a delightful stay! It was just wonderful in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis in the heart of the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GTOttawa
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in 1996, and liked it so much we went back 15 years later. It has improved. It is in the heart of the Latin Quarter, which bustles with students, local residents and some tourists, although not nearly as many tourists as other parts of Paris. What strikes you most about this place is that is in a secluded courtyard, complete with mature trees, and tables and chairs where you can sip your own wine, dine (bring your own food), visit, read a book, etc. Step out the gate into the quiet street, and about a block to your left is the Place de la Contrescarpe, a small and unique square surrounded by restaurants and cafes. Off the square is Rue Mouffetard, a narrow and lively corridor peppered with restaurants, ethnic takeout counters and specialty shops. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Notre Dame, the Pantheon, the Jardins de Luxembourg and the Jardins des Plantes. Our room was in the older building. Very nice, although basic and not exceptionally comfortable. When we were there in 96 they were constructing a new building across the courtyard. We did not see these rooms but would assume they are nicer. The hotel has no restaurant but serves a great continental breakfast (best croissants and baguettes I have had in France), which you can enjoy in the pleasant breakfast room or out on the terrace. The staff are friendly and gracious and will even give you access to the kitchen to chill your wine or borrow some utensils for your patio dinner. The place is quite secure, with access to the street through a huge steel door which is locked at night (ring the staff to get in). Just a lovely hotel, informal and comfortable but professionally run and very clean. If you want peace and quiet in Paris, with easy access to the rest of the city, and prefer the ambience of a smaller hotel, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and charm on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: Duchesse
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice, with our sons. The hotel is in a deep courtyard, surrounded by greenery. Rooms are charming, well-decorated and very comfortable, No air conditioning; in the evening, the caretaker would water down the garden, to keep the air cool. Our rooms had no TVs, either, which we liked. The rooms are average size *for Paris* and you are welcome to sit in the courtyard with a glass of wine or a coffee and read- most pleasant, Your breakfast is served in the courtyard by bustling, cheerful staff. A true oasis, loved by value-seekers, so book extra early. Fantastic value. Hotel very graciously kept our bags when we left for a week-long excursion, then returned,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, idealic”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel numerous times now. It is lovely and the enclosed courtyard is so quiet and peaceful amidst the hustle bustle of Paris. The staff are very friendly and the breakfast breads and coffee wonderful. BUT the advertised WiFi is horrible and undependable. We usually had to sit in the courtyard to get any reception at all. Though I asked for extra pillows three times and it was always quickly agreed they'd give us some, no extra pillows ever materialized. With those caveats, it's a wonderful place to stay with a tiny, creaky elevator that carries you and your luggage to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyrab
Reviews.Content: What an oasis in Paris. Great community feeling having drinks in the lush and gorgeous courtyard garden at the end of a hectic day. No tv (great) and very comfortable, clean rooms. Ours was overlooking garden. Staff very helpful and efficient. Fantastic location in a quieter part of Paris, and close to metro. Every guest we met (heaps)would return to this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here absolutely disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: LCGOOD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel we stayed in in our whole european trip, we booked months in advance and were given room two (2) it was like a gaol cell without the amenities. Let me start in the bathroom, it was mouldy the soap dish and toilet roll holder were broken and hangng off the wall there was no soap holder in the shower and the toilet leaked all the time. Lets move to the bedroom, I hope you can sleep standing up as the bed is a smelly excuse for a bed, on arrival we asked for two more pillows, we got one and the excuse was "thats all we can find". This room, and I use the term room very loosely, had vertical and horizontal bars on the window which had three steps outside, guess what, this used to be the entrance hall that they have now made a gaol, ooops room. No aircon, no refrigerator, no tv, and phone that does not work, but wait for it, you get a fan that is older than me and makes more noise!!!! Lets now move on reception and wow what a work of art this is, they tell us they have free WiFi, when we inquire the response is I do not know the codes and we are out of the cards that give this information. We also wanted to hire a car, again I went to reception, well you can forget attempting to ask at reception they just do not care. In finishing, and I could add more but I think you understand by now that this place is just a disgrace, it boasts 3 stars what a joke, this place should not have one star, it smells, it is cramped, old,and poorly serviced by people who just do not care, an alternative which is comprable would be to sleep on the street (this would be cleaner) or hire a car and stay in it, for it would certainly be cleaner, more comfortable and at least the hire car staff may be of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location. Fantastic Staff. Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: RussianRiverWineGuy
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. And I was pleased to discover this hotel several years ago. The hotel and the neighborhood are exciting. Some people are never happy, so on sites like Trip Advisor, I recommend travelers ignore the awful reviews because that's from the person who paid a hundred bucks and wanted the Georges V. And the best, glowing review was written by the hotel owner. I've never had a dirty room here. No leaking pipes. But pipes do break, so maybe this other reviewer got unlucky. As for rude. I doubt it. But it is remarkable how we (American) travelers sense someone is rude when there is a language barrier and the other person does not speak perfect English, or simply when the host has no way to "fix" whatever it is we consider a problem. I do know that this hotel has a rule not to accept reservations too far in advance. And I guarantee you the day the date you are permitted to make reservations arrives, you'd better do it. The rooms you want will all be booked the next day. That says a lot about people who come here. This is a French hotel in an old Parisian building. Yes, there are rooms with slanting walls and low ceilings. If you want an American Holiday Inn type hotel, I recommend the Concorde Lafayette.

Reviews.Title: “Such a secret place, dont tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: kazg10
Reviews.Content: It was so lovely I almost dont want to do a review. This hotel is in the Latin Quarter of Paris on the left bank. A beautiful old building with a lovely garden and cobblestoned path leading up to it. The staff were so friendly. It had old world charm and given that the rooms were old world as well. Nothing new and boutique about it. If you want modern this is not the hotel for you. They are a small hotel and because of this will only take reservations from three months beforehand. Rooms are comfortable as I said with old world charm which means older furnishings etc. This to me only made it more charming but to others that could be a downside. You can ask for a ground floor room overlooking the garden which gives you lovely french doors opening up to the green trees and shrubs. People would just sit and relax and read and order food and I would loook down hours later after a frenzied day out shopping to see the same people just relaxing in the same spot. It is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle but just outside there are numerous restaurants to chose from and a Metro stop just a few minutes walk away. I thought of it as a sanctuary. The staff were very friendly and in a place where sometimes the French are not known for being overtly friendly this was different. They felt like friends and the lovely lady who catered for us while we were waiting for our rooms gave us a fanstatic breakfast laughing and chatting and it felt like home. People who like new and stylish would not like this place but if you are after old world charm with friendly faces and an oasis of garden in a busy city it is perfect. They also have an elevator for those not able to use the stairs. Magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick get away”
Reviews.Author: MargieNY
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a 4 day weekend for my 50th birthday and it was perfect! great location, great price. enjoyed having wine and cheese in the afternoon in garden

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather E
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful and affordable gem in the city of Paris. While it was a walk up the hill from the Metro, walking into their courtyard was so quiet from the hustle and bustle of the streets outside. Walking into the building, we were greeted by the tall ceilings and white woodwork. The reception was immediately to the left. Our room was ready when we arrived which was on the 2nd floor(technically the 3rd since the main floor is ground level then 1). It was nice that they had a small elevator to take luggage up. Walking into the room was like taking a step back in elegant time. The wallpaper and decor was simple Paris decor, but inviting. Our window opened into the courtyard which had birds singing outside, there were no sounds from the street since the hotel is located further in a wide expanse of the block. While we did not stick around to enjoy the surroundings at the hotel, the room was comfortable, beds and temperature included(don't know about a typical summer day when the weather would be hot, it was raining for our visit, in JULY!, there is no air conditioning).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, a hidden secret”
Reviews.Author: VReynolds
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in Paris before we did the Canal du Midi and the south of France. This hotel was an oasis, perfect location within walking distance to the Metro and St Germain/St Michel. The rooms were large and clean, great bathroom and a lovely outlook onto the courtyard. What a bonus! Every evening, guests gather in the courtyard with their own wine and beer, baguette and cheese, and share stories about their day. The hosts could not be kinder, providing glasses, plates, cutlery, all at no expense! Would definitely recommend this hotel - we stayed in room 33 on the ground floor, opposite reception and the breakfast room. Heaven.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend to my best friends”
Reviews.Author: lettyellen2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but very clean light and airy with windows that open to the courtyard. The courtyard tables and chairs invited residents to share a drink or a meal in the evening. Good food shopping close by, plus plenty of cafes and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it so much that I am going back this summer!!!”
Reviews.Author: dejs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a special place! Located in the 7th arr., it is close to lots of restaurants and sights. Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, The Pantheon and The Louvre are all within easy walking distance. I loved the area surrounding the hotel as it is full of students and bustling with energy. This hotel was recommended by a very good friend and I cannot say enough about it. First, it is nestled behind the main street and accessible through a large wooden door. Once inside the door, there is a beautiful garden where guests congregate with their wine, baguettes, cheese and stories of their adventures of the day. I always looked forward to these impromptu gatherings! The rooms are nicely decorated and small by US standards, but probably the norm for Europeans. But the staff is what sets this place apart. Marie and Dorata became friends and we spent loads of time laughing together. Of course they are knowledgeable about the area, but they went out of their way to help us with a rental car issue and a few other glitches that we encountered. When I decided to go back to Paris this summer, I first checked with them for availability, BEFORE I booked the flight. That says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient, Charming”
Reviews.Author: ESusan
Reviews.Content: A block away, a huge party can be taking place in the middle of the Latin Quarter, and you will not hear it at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles. In the evening we sat out in the court yard drinking wine and making new friends with people from Australia, Germany, Scotland, and other parts of France. Yes, the rooms are small-ish, but for the price, the location, and the sheer joy of being in the heart of Paris, this place is a bargain. Reservations open up 90 days before you want to be there. Don't miss the 90 day deadline because this place books very quickly. AND, don't miss Cafe Descartes right out the door of the hotel and turn left - fabulous food, atmosphere, and people.

Reviews.Title: “Provence in the Middle of the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: painter/traveler
Reviews.Content: In so many ways this hotel is the perfect place to explore the Latin Quarter. It’s as if you’ve left Paris for the countryside. The décor is decidedly French pastoral: Provencal wallpaper, doilies, and embroidered bead spreads. Occasionally, the din of the hard partying students of the nearby Sorbonne echoes through, but mostly it’s perfectly serene. We booked nearly a year in advance and asked for a quiet room overlooking the courtyard on the second floor for fear that the first floor would be too noisy. Alas, we were still given a room on the first floor. Our fears were not unfounded: the rolling parade of luggage across the cobblestones begins promptly at 6:00 am. Our introduction to the hotel was less than stellar: in spite of our politeness, the late night desk clerk was less a person than a caricature of French haughtiness. Fortunately, Marie was friendliness personified and Dorita, one of the maids, greeted us each morning with a tray of coffee and fresh croissants and a warm Bonjour. Some reviewers have complained about the lack of television, but personally I rejoiced in the chirping of the birds as opposed to the harsh sounds of competing t.v. programs. There is a breakfast room for rainy days, but stake out a table in the courtyard for a leisurely breakfast when the weather permits. You’ll find that before you know it, the tables around you will be filled up with people who’ve seen you from the breakfast room and migrated outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles was an up and down experience for us”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: The price is fantastic - very competitive for 5eme and Paris especially. The owner Marie, and (I believe?) her husband are beyond friendly, helpful and charming. To quote my hubs when we first checked in with Marie, "She just sings when she speaks, doesn't she?" He was a bit in awe :) Our room was on the top floor with a stellar view of the gardens and the courtyard, where many hotel guests congregated in the morning for a hotel-provided breakfast (9 euros extra) and in the afternoons and evenings over a bottle of wine or an impromptu picnic, or simply to relax and read among the foliage and birdsong. The not-so-good: the bed was very hard. We are spoiled to no end by the new iteration of hotel chic which includes a cloud-like mattress and duvet found in all the major hotels now, so the old-fashioned hard bed was even more noticeable. To the point that each morning I woke up with sore hips, which is not something that usually, if ever, happens. When we first arrived in our room, we found a sign that read something to the effect of "Please, dear guests, do not do your laundry in the room as there is a laundromat just down the street. Also, please do not bring any outside food into your room." Initially, I thought the sign was quaint. However, as we passed said laundromat and saw the prices, I realized that no guest in their right ind would use it over a free bathroom sink. And after perusing the Rue Mouffetard with all it's amazing shops (cheese, cured meats, fresh fruit and vegetables, marinated olives and mushrooms, boulangeries, Belgian chocolates, need I go on???) and realizing that the area was MADE for picnicking, we of course so wanted to have a room picnic to celebrate all the local fare we found on Rue Mouffetard. Alas no, no outside food allowed in our room. I felt a bit like a recalcitrant teenager wanting to rebel, but we followed the rules. Last of the not-so-good: the Internet was incredibly spotty (or rather, mostly down). We were given a site and an access code for sign-in but after our first night it ceased to work. The hotel finally gave us the name of their own wifi spot and it worked, as long as we went down to the courtyard or hung, precariously, out our 3rd-floor window. Back to the good! The hotel is gorgeous! The courtyard is absolutely lovely and made for spending time whiling away the day. The hosts are absolutely charming and the Latin quartier location is fantastic! The hotel was close to the Pantheon, le Contrescarpe, rue Mouffetard and the Cardinal Lemoine Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Latin Quarter Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLeah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis well located in the Latin Quarter of Paris. Pros: The beautiful garden courtyard where the owners have provided tables and chairs for the guests to use. We were informed that we could bring our own bottle of wine to enjoy in the garden and we did just that. The front desk manager opened the bottle for us and provided wine glasses; the excellent location which is a few blocks from the metro stop (Cardinal Lemoine); the friendly, caring staff; the old style charming rooms; the many eateries within a few blocks; the 9 euro breakfast which I didn't try but it goes later than any other hotel I've stayed in - it ends at 11 am; I have to mention the beautiful garden courtyard again because it was so beautiful and unexpected! Cons: There was no TV in our room but the hotel may have rooms that do have TVs - I didn't ask for one; there wasn't a safe in our room but there is a hotel safe which we used to store our passports and extra cash and credit card; the elevator made a strange noise which was bothersome as we are light sleepers; the wi-fi didn't work well for me which again could have been a momentary problem. I didn't try it more than one night and it was so slow many of the pages I was trying to load timed out; there was no shower in our bathroom - however, the bathtub was very deep and came with an attached shower assembly but not the type that is hooked up on the wall. I didn't mind this but if you must have a typical US style shower in the morning, you might ask if there are rooms that have typical showers. There was plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Also, a note on water quality - I drank tap water in Paris which I wouldn't do at home in Los Angeles! It smelled and tasted very fresh. I will stay here again definitely and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “charming but suggest short stay is best”
Reviews.Author: NigelandLiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel early March. It was a return visit having previously stayed in the summer of 2009. The hotel is still charmingly French and the location good. The bubbly breakfast waitress is still there and just as bubbly. However on this occasion our stay was for 8 nights and we found the hotel just a little too basic for more than a few nights stay. The rooms have no television or tea/coffee making facilities. At the end of a long day exploring it is nice to be able to catch a news broadcast to see what is happening in the world or make a coffee before going to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dp2_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 51 rooms in four buildings set around a cobble stone courtyard. The gate from the street into the courtyard is locked to non-guests after 8 PM. They do not want you bringing food into the room (for sanitary reasons I assume). But picking up some cheese, crackers and wine at a local market and enjoying them at one of the small tables in the courtyard is great way to round off an afternoon of sightseeing; and an opportunity to make new friends. Wireless Internet available, no TV; but we came to see Paris not the news. Marie manages and her family owns the hotel. If you plan to stay call Marie early and ask for a room opening onto the courtyard. She speaks English fluently and has a sense of humor. They will not accept reservations more than 4 months before your stay and the best rooms book up quickly. During our stay, for convenience, we ate breakfast at the hotel every day, but I felt it was a little pricey for the typical French breakfast of juice, croissants and coffee; Euro 9 per person...about $25 for the two of us. Of course I'm looking at it from a US point of view. Even with breakfasts added to the room rate I still think this hotel is a very good value in the 5th arrondissement and we will stay here on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Aniajoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, each day was full of sightseeing and wonderment. We arrived @ about 10am and our room was not yet ready (check in 1.00pm), so we left our luggage at the charming reception, and with map in hand went walking. The hotel was perfectly positioned in the Latin Quarter, so close to rue Mouffetard (great place to eat at night) and so many sights. The room was on the small side but full of character and I loved the fact that you can open the window to look out onto the beautiful courtyard. The room was very clean and quiet at night, we will return for a longer stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Secret garden in the Latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: jsunder106
Reviews.Content: We agonized over where to stay for the first week of our Paris adventure, and much research led us to the grand Ecoles. The metro station is cardinal limone; it is easy to find in the Latin quarter withIn walking distance to the sarbonne, the luxenbourge gardens, the pantheon etc and with easy access to the metro ,all of Paris and beyond is at your feet. The entire hotel is comprised of two mansard roofed structures separated by a cobble stone drive and elegantly presented gardens. Our room transported us the the belle epoch era, resplendent in historically accurate toile and furnishings that were accurate to the time, and very comfortable. We had the second floor corner room facing the courtyard. From the street the hotel and gardens are totally hidden; you knock on a large door under a small sign and gush with excitement as you see the secret world revealed within! Breakfasts were delicious; the dining room contains pictures of many happy guests, which lends a personal,homey feel. The english speaking staff was very helpful with reservations and advice. We discovered a cafe, the Descartes , which is a quick 1and 1/2 blocks to your left as you exit on the street. There we enjoyed late afternoon wine ( cote du rhone), duck confite with fries---- heaven . It's a sports bar, but if you sit on the more expensive terrace you can just watch the french world flavored by the environs of one of the oldest universities in Europe ( the Sorbonne), go by. Our room was large with a table and chairs for dining en suite. The bathroom had all of the essentials was was spotless, well planned and designed. After sight seeing and walking all day every day we slept soundly for the duration of our 5 day stay. We are planning to return this fall for the bugolais neuvo:-)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: marlazoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago and was pleased but NOT THIS TIME. WHAT A FILTHY DUMP and RUDE receptionist and hotel manager made matters worse. Traveling with my 81-year old mother, therefore I was very specific as to what room we wanted having stayed there two years ago. Room was confirmed, in writing. When we arrived, they had put us in the attic! Sloping ceilings were NOT charming, especially since neither of us could stand-up straight in the ridiculously tiny room. After complaining, they moved us to a room next to the reception area that was noisy and VERY DIRTY. Needless to say, we checked out the next morning. To make matters worse, there was a sign in the room stating: "We ask that you do not wash and hang laundry in the room and that you go to the laundermat down the street. Also, do not bring outside food into the room." Being that this dump can barely hold onto it's 2-stars, I was floored that they would tell us not to wash our panties and socks out in the sink - especially considering the bathroom had mold in the grout, peeling wall paper and several leak stains on the walls that were already showing proof of mold. I would advise people to STAY AWAY FROM THIS DUMP! Filthy beyond belief!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: nuyawkfiddler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Jan 26th to February 4th, 2011. This was my first trip to France. After researching sites like Trip Advisor, Rick Steve's etc I decided to settle on this one. The hotel is located behind the Pantheon in the University of Paris district. My room was immaculate and had fairly new plush carpeting. For an additional 8 euros you can have a continental breakfest. The coffee is very good - orange juice, a good baquet and a tasty croissant. Marie and her staff are very friendly and run a very professional hotel. This hotel focuses on the most important items - clean rooms, quiet and nice atomosphere. Forget about the doorman, bellhop, big screen television and room service. Go to the Four Sesons if that's your preference. WIFI cost an additional eight euros for 24 hours service. This internet constantly logs you off and reenteing the password frequently was annoying. You can take the RER B line directly to the airport at Luxembourg station and walk to the hotel. If you prefer to haul your suitcase around a Metro station, getting off the RER B at St-Michel (Notre-Dame) and transferring to the Metro 10 (Gare d'Austerlitz) and get off at Cardinal Lemoine. It is a shorter walk to the hotel from the station but the net difference the same compared to walking from Luxembourg. I prefer to stay on the RER B to Luxemborg and walk to the hotel (providing it's not raining). It's fewer stairs than doing the RER/Metro transfer mess. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great location, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: jen10583
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles. We are a family of five, so finding reasonable accomodations in europe can be a challenge--most hotels cannot accomodate five people in one room, but this one can. We ended up booking two rooms (our preference), a double and a triple. The location was in the latin quarter, 1 long block from the cardinal lemoine metro station. There was a great strip of restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance, and Notre Dame was a nice walk away. The "lobby" (really just a front office) and breakfast room were tiny but charming. Staff spoke english when necessary and were helpful. Rooms were small, sparse, and clean--no TV (which I didn't mind at all). My husband found the bed too soft, but I was fine. Soundproofing was lacking, but didn't pose a major problem. Reasonable charge for internet. Continental breakfast at 8 euros pp was fairly priced and delicious. Bring your own soap/shampoo/washcloth--otherwise, all in all, a great value, and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT little hotel, oasis of peace in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mrsmikael
Reviews.Content: this hotel is sheer perfection. I've stayed at the Ritz and other five stars in Paris and everywhere else, and I'd rather be at this hotel any day of the week. An honest , peaceful, clean and truly beautiful little hotel with wonderful staff who leave you alone, a huge plus in my book!!! and housekeeping who are only happy to wait till late if you feel like sleeping till three, no annoying knocks on door and when they do clean, it's spotless! the hotel is a very rare find in paris, esp for this neighborhood, in the heart of Hemingway's old haunt, the fifth, half a block from his apartment, and it's like alittle village inside paris. Underground parking, very james Bond:) , and mechanized doors from 19th century open to little vllage of hotel. you can go whole stay and not see anyone if you like as rooms are in independent houses, and reception is to back of courtyard. I felt like I was staying in a private home, wonderful. and my room was a dream, high ceilings, beautiful blue chintz, comfortable beds, I slept like a log!! love this place, can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot in great location”
Reviews.Author: wandala
Reviews.Content: Just returned; rooms are larger than most European hotel rooms, as are the bathrooms. We were in the courtyard (jardin) rooms on the top floor; supremely quiet, no noise at all. Funny policy of no food in rooms or self-laundry, but the prime location enabled us to do laundry and get whatever we needed to eat at any time day or night. The Cardinal Lemoine metro stop is good for some left bank stops, but a few blocks away is the Place Monge (pink line) stop, which goes to the Right bank as well...and more places than the Lemoine route. All in all a delightful stay, good service, unobtrusive. The beds are those narrow european ones and the pillows not great, but we slept very well in the well-appointed rooms. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel - can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: DaiseyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed at this gorgeous little hotel for 2 nights in September on our way to Provence. We were given the "little apartment" which was very spacious and included a living area. Lovely setting with its cobblestoned driveway and outdoor area. We caught the metro from CDG - take RER B towards Saint-Remy-les-Chevreuse or Robinson, get off at St Michel, walk through tunnel to Metro Cluny La Sorbonne and take line 10 towards Gare D'Austerlitx and get off at Cardinal Lemoine. As you come out of the Metro turn left and walk about 250m up Rue de Cardinal - very easy to find. Just further up the street is a square full of cafes, restaurants, a supermarket etc. - great atmosphere at night. Adequate breakfast of baguette, croissant, spreads, juice and coffee in their little dining room. Very helpful staff. Wifi connection - 4Euro. Would have loved to have stayed here for at least a week. Would definitely stay there next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NickyMcKee
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we've stayed at this hotel and as usual we found all the staff very welcoming and attentive. The courtyard is a lovely place to sit and chill out and helps make the hotel feel much less claustrophobic than other places that we have stayed. The rooms are clean, quiet and fairly large. Breakfast is simple but tasty, the waitress was really friendly and made a big fuss of the children which they loved! After trying out several hotels in Paris, this is the one that we now always come back to.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: StephTobin
Reviews.Content: Friends had stayed here some years ago and I had read about it in the Frommer's books. We had one of the cheaper rooms--120 euros--but it was very charming, very comfortable, with a very clean, modern bathroom. It's on an enclosed courtyard and is very quiet and peaceful. The service was excellent and it was within easy walking distance of some very interesting parts of the city: Rue Mouffetard, the Pantheon, Jardin de Luxembourg. There's also a fantastic Thai restaurant down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinichic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully situated and overall just a truly lovely hotel. The rooms are on the small side - as a somewhat typical European hotel's rooms will be - but completely functional and the courtyard makes up for any lack of space in the actual rooms. I loved that the rooms don't have television - it forces you out to enjoy yourself and get to know the city. If staying in the area keep in mind that you'll be in Ernest Hemmingway's neighborhood and just steps from where he stayed while in Paris in the 1920's - so get out and walk the streets that Hemmingway looked down on watching the milking goats being led through the streets. The staff is friendly and helpful, the receptionists seem completely fluent in English but the room keepers speak very, very little English, yet are very kind and do their best to communicate.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous: Hotel Fails to Respect Confirmed Reservation”
Reviews.Author: tea42California_USA
Reviews.Content: After doing fairly extensive research and reserving a room months in advance, we arrived at the hotel after a long and exhausting day of travel to be told i) they had made an error and effectively double booked our room for the first of our planned and confirmed three night stay, ii) they had called around to find an alternative, but none was available below 400+ Euro/night, so iii) the only alternative they could offer us was to stay in a basement conference room with no shower, no window, and most importantly, no source of air (as there was no ventilation). (As an aside, I cannot imagine this makeshift accommodation met French occupancy codes.) The hotel garden is a fine place, but unless you are willing to roll the dice and end up spending the night sitting in the garden, look for other options. It is completely outrageous that the only measures this establishment was willing to undertake to address their error were those which cost them nothing, i.e., apologies and offers of free breakfast. If in fact this place often operates at or close to full capacity, such errors seems likely to occur and the chances of being left without a place to stay need to be factored into your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Classic European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: certamenator
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Ecoles is definitely better than the average European hotel. Although it has no air conditioning, the rooms aren't too hot, thanks to the fans, courtyard setup, and large windows. The bed was king-sized, and the bathroom was very large. The room had a small table with two chairs, bedside tables, and a closet, but no television. The landscaped courtyard is a fun place to eat crepes from nearby restaurants, and the Mouffetard neighborhood is full of good places to eat. The one problem with this hotel was the overenthusiastic African maids (they could barely speak French, and spoke no English). They kept unplugging our fan, and came into the room at 9 AM without knocking first. However, everyone was very kind, and our room was kept very clean. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much OK”
Reviews.Author: awo1
Reviews.Content: The location is very nice, in a inner courtyard with roses etc....you can have breakfast in the garden and also enjoy nightlife in the evenings. usually quiet place but in summer people could sit outside and then its a problem to find sleep (because they talk). Very friendly owner family - pre-booking required as early as possible. Parking - as always in Paris - can be a problem as the garage has just a few places. come without a car. They rooms are comfortable and more then enough. I would even go there on a private trip as I have seen many french hotel and this one is a nice one...

Reviews.Title: “Now wonderful in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JImmieNY
Reviews.Content: How wonderful this hotel is. It costed about 150 Euros a night for 3 persons with one single and one double beds in a peak season, August. There is no TV set in a room, but the quiet and cozy garden in the noisy city. In the comfortable garden, we could have some cups of coffee by request to a concierge. The other group was drinking some wine in the early evening under the sunshine in summer. I have never stayed such a nice hotel in Paris. Its staff was very kind and friendly. I would like to book it again when visiting there. Near the hotel, there are some restaurants and a super market. It is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, lovely garden, quiet, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BobHLeverett
Reviews.Content: If I had to imagine a nearly perfect French hotel, this would be it. I will never stay any place else when in Paris. A colleague recommended this hotel and I am very happy that I took the advice. This is an exceptional 3-star hotel. One enters the property through a high wide doorway and finds a wonderful garden with table and chairs. Many rooms in the hotel face this garden area and are protected from the street noise. Some rooms do face a street and so it would be sensible to ask for one facing the garden if you are troubled by street noise. The rooms have a large reciprocating fan in case it is warm (there is no air conditioning – and some may consider this a disadvantage). The rooms are adequately large and so are the en suite bathrooms – which is not always the case in hotels in Paris. The beds are comfortable and there is plenty of storage space. Wireless is available – you purchase time by purchasing a card with a password and you can buy 1 hour, 3 hours or 24 hours. And, the clock only runs when you are signed on. So, in my case, I took the 24 hour card and this was more than adequate for an entire week (and the price was 8 Euros for the 24 hours). The other options: 1 hour for 3 Euros and 3 hours for 4 Euros. The wireless works from any place on the property. Breakfast – bread, pastry, coffee and juice – is available for 8 Euros. But, you can also visit nearby markets and buy cereal and fruit if you like and order only coffee and sit in the garden and have what you brig in. Major food is discouraged in the rooms, but something like a box of cereal is OK. The basic price for our room was 130 Euros per night (tax is added), and we thought that this was a very fine price for the quality of the hotel. If it rains, the hotel will lend you a good quality umbrella. They will also make dinner reservations, call you a cab, etc. All in all, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AussieJB62
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles. The garden is lovely late afternoon and guests chat among themselves over a glass of wine (which you can buy from the bottle shop a 5 minute walk away). A lively local scene of dozens of restaurants within walking distance (as well as great icecream) Or simply sit at the bar in the square and watch the world go by. A metro station a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Never again in summer”
Reviews.Author: Janettravels44
Reviews.Content: I have recommended this hotel to friends for years since a lovely stay there in early June 15 years ago. But never again for summer. First the good stuff. The garden is wonderful. The hotel has about 40 rooms and there are 10 tables in the garden so we never had trouble finding a spot in the shade for breakfast or just to sit and enjoy. And the hotel is gracious about providing water, glasses for wine you bring in and the garden is a great spot for picnic lunch or dinner from one of the nearby bakeries. The wifi which costs 8E for 24 hours of actual use which is reasonable -- reaches to the garden. The rooms though charmingly decorated are also well past time for refurbishing -- ours looked like someone had had a distressing biological disaster (or perhaps a pet had) and the rug cleaning not entirely successful -- it felt 'clean' but the stains were still disgusting. The wallpaper was stained and worn. But worst of all was our attic room on a hot day. It was 100 degrees in our room and the hallway when we retired each night. The fan provided for the room barely got it into the high 80s or low 90s at night. The skylight in the stairwell if opened might have allowed for cross draft and evacuation of heat but it stayed firmly locked down so all the heat in the building rose to the attic and stayed there. It is unconscionable to book attic rooms this time of year and then not do the rather simple things necessary to evacuate heat. My uncle's farmhouse in the 1940s used a ceiling fan to pull heat out at night -- this is heat management 101. This is a hotel -- the lack of concern for taking the simple steps in air design to make these rooms livable is ridiculous. The nights got cool enough that with adequate airflow, the rooms while unlivable in the day would have been manageable at night. To compound the misery and it was a miserable room in the heat, the elevator went out. I know stuff happens and they were doing their best to fix it -- but when you book a hotel with an elevator and are on the 4th floor (third French) and you are elderly -- you don't expect to be hauling luggage several flights down. The young man who seemed to be in charge had to be forcefully asked for assistance -- his general approach to old people with the luggage problem because of his failed elevator was 'oh I wish we had a bellboy for times like these'. He did finally reluctantly assist with the larger suitcase. The hotel has its charms. Breakfast in the garden while the usual overpriced skimp of Paris is lovely because of the garden. The garden itself is a wonderful asset. But book in July or August knowing you may be sleeping in 90 degree heat.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: XJ6man
Reviews.Content: Our second visit after 22 years, and just as delightful. The service was excellent. Staff willingly assisted with web check-in for our return flights to Australia, the room was clean, with a spotless bathroom where all the plumbing worked as it should. A good hot shower. Breakfast in the courtyard a real treat, the atmosphere tops. So well located for everything. We walked to the great restaurants of Rue Mouffetard (2 mins), and the Seine (10 mins), with all the clasic tourist spots around Isle de la Cite. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming rooms, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MonetMonkeys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles with my family and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to many major attractions and to the Metro. There are many places to eat close by. There is an enclosed courtyard that was a good place to sit and relax. Although not a Hilton nor a Radission, this hotel is charming, well-run, and thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quiet and secure”
Reviews.Author: pottsaway
Reviews.Content: Loved this spot. We were unsure before we arrived but were pleasantly surprised. Close to underground when required, but close enough to walk to sights as well. Great range of restaurants close by, as well as supermarkets, a Laundromat and pubs!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: JiminVA
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel-- great location in the thick of the bustling, hip Latin Quarter, yet insulated from all noise in a beautiful garden courtyard. Charming small European hotel, fantastic location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Clara16
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel in a charming area, near the Contrescarpe place. There is a beautiful room where you can enjoy a typical french breakfast and in the summer, you can even eat outside. The only negative thing I would have to say is that there is no A/C. We went in May so it was not an issue but when it gets really hot outside, it may be uncomfortable in the rooms. The rooms are really clean and the staff really polite and helpful. I would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: empjm
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here for 3 nights. It is a unique property in Latin Quarter. The unassuming entrance leads you into a beautiful cobblestone courtyard. We had rooms 217 & 218 in main building. One had 2 beds, 1 single and 1 double and the other room had 1 double bed. Only negative was carpet in one room was recently shampooed and carpet was still damp. Bathrooms were small but adequate with combination bathtub/shower. Breakfast was 8 euro per person and was very pleasantly served. It consisted of coffee or tea, juice, croissant and bread. Beds were comfortable and we had no problems with noise. It is 2 blocks away from Metro stop (Cardinal Lemoine). 2 other metro stops are only 3 blocks away. There are many restaurants within a few blocks. Great hotel to base your tour of Paris. Wireless internet available for a fee. (8 euro for 24 total hours of use, not daily.)

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Paris wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sbcook
Reviews.Content: There are already so many positive reviews for the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles, but had to add ours to the list. Charming, fantastic locations, wonderful staff. Our room was larger than expected, very clean and comfortable. Just steps from the wonderful place de la Contrescarpe which had cafes, bakeries, pubs, groceries and only a couple of blocks from the metro. The garden courtyard is lovely (as was Paris in April). Perfect place for a quiet, comfortable stay in a fantastic location - close to the Pantheon, Luxembourg gardens, Notre Dame. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: USAtouristcom
Reviews.Content: The rooms were supprisingly spacious for a hotel in the heart of Paris. They were clean and nicely decorated. The staff was courteous and helpful. The inner courtyard garden was a delightful refuge. The Grand Ecole is located in the Latin Quarter near the Sorbonne University. It is about a mile from the Left Bank with its tourist oriented neighborhood. This neighborhood is more authentic Parisian with many small restaurants, food markets and take-out shops within a few blocks of the hotel. The Metro stop is just two blocks down the street. It is a real bargain to find such comfort at an affordable price right in the heart of Paris. The hotel charged an extra eight Euros per day for the continental breakfast which was minimal and very tasty but a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend but needs air-con!”
Reviews.Author: tikalove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer (2009) in August. It was very hot and there was no air-con so the room was hot, even at night. The location is good. I HIGHLY recommend room 251 if you are 3 or more. There is a curtain you can draw for a bit of privacy for and from teenagers! It's at the front of the hotel so people watching from your window is great! We initially were in the room right across from 251, what a difference! 251 has loads more space so get that one if you can. We had breakfast there every morning. The courtyard is really nice an the price is ok €9 person for juice, pastry and tea. I thought it was worth it. We had to buy a card for the internet. I found that annoying. The staff is helpful but most of them didn't speak English very well. I think if you're in the hotel industry you should be able to converse with your guests and English is pretty universal! The one front desk gal did not do a good job at helping us get to the airport. We ended up paying a small fortune as she did not give us good advice to reach the airport that 1 1/2 hrs away!!! I would recommend this place and may stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place in busy Paris”
Reviews.Author: johnboymadisonct
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Two blocks to a Metro station, short walk to the Seine, Ile St. Louis, Norte Dame,the Bastille & Blvd. St. Germaine. Only 51 rooms, but off main streets and rooms are around a courtyard where you can relax out doors - yes there are tables & chairs to do this. The staff were friendly and accomodating. Made dinner reservations at restaurants that I had researched. Rooms are small but this is Paris and the price was 120 euros a night. Baths were modern.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-but don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Yummy_mummy43Surrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for a shor break with our 2 young children. It is perfectly situated as it is in a historic, genteel location, plus accessible to various metro stations with which to explore the city. Rooms are spotless and comfortable, quiet at night too. The saff were very friendly and appreciated very muchour efforts to speak french. They even gave my children Easter eggs upon our departure! A wonderful place for solo travellers, small groups, families and couples alike. Breakfast is sufficient although unexciting, but we would not have missed the charming breakfast room and the April fools' jokes played on the guests! The hotel is charming and will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Happy51Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Lovely secluded hotel in the heart of Paris. Staff were very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Excellent location for food in the evening adn a short walk from metro. We would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles”
Reviews.Author: DerekT23
Reviews.Content: This was a really friendly hotel, tastfully decorated in a traditional french manner, the breakfast was well presented and adequate ( 9 euros from 1/4), a previous comment suggested it was wamed up, but witnessed bakery items being delivered when going out for a run, early one morning. Our room 108 was ok ,asked for two extra pillows and they were there within 5 minutes, the matress did encourage you to move to the middle, however not a big issue. if we go back to Paris it will be to the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Parisian - zero tourists zone!”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: My stay was magnificent - from my Courtyard "Blue Room" to the cobblestones and secluded garden and the friendly service, it was all great! Some reviews say there are no cafes or shops nearby: they must'nt have walked 5 mins up the hill where there's a gorgeous piazza with fabulous cafes and a little road filled with restaurants including the Pot de Terre where the 3 Musketeers used to meet! This is the home of Descartes and the famous schools of Paris and it's a stone's throw fro the Metro. Walk to Notre Dame and St Germain de Pres. The patisseries and wonderful surrounds were just fantastique! I will definitely stay there every time I go to Paris - next time I'll take my Mum. I'd say this hotel is not suited to fat Americans or bad tempered British people or people who have no sense of romance or history. It's gorgeous - sure there's no TV but who goes to Paris to watch TV?!? I drank wine in my room, I also rinsed out lingerie there was no problem and the maids were really lovely. If you have the time, sit out in the courtyard and don't eat breakfast at the hotel, walk the 5 mins or less and have a choice of lovely cafes!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quiet spot in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: RomyDeeJay
Reviews.Content: Imagine a tiny oasis in the middle of the hustle-bustle of the rue Mouffetard. It's hard to believe that you can sleep, for 130 euros a night, in the heart of Paris on a peaceful interior courtyard. We were there during an especially cold winter, so we weren't disturbed by revelers in the courtyard... though I'm not sure what it would be like in the summer as the hotel guests smoke, drink, and chat outside at the many tables and chairs provided for warmer weather. Don't hesitate in Winter: we slept so well! Also, the service is phenomenal: Marie is on the front desk and is endlessly charming and accommodating, as is Dorota at breakfast and a whole team of friendly housekeeping staffers, creating the impression that this a great place to work. Rooms are fairly spacious in Batiment jardin, and the bathroom is palatial by French standards. All that said, however... If you're looking for modern, business-style comfort, this is probably not the place for you: you have no DSL, no real WI-FI except through paid cards in the crowded, fairly claustrophobic breakfast room, no lobby, no business facilities of any kind, no safe in the room, no fridge, no TV, no coffee pot.... Breakfast is not included and is fairly standard: coffee, juice, bread, croissant and nothing much comped. A couple of thousand dollars later, maybe they'll offer you a hot tea while the room is being cleaned. If you need a more corporate comfort, this probably won't work for you: imagine coming back to your room and finding it "half" made up because the maid has gone to have lunch for 2 hours. But if you're looking for charm, it has all that in spades.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely home base in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JamieAnne2
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, beautifully appointed and well kept. Fabulous staff. We felt at home immediately. The courtyard and garden add a natural and relaxing element to the day. Coffee and croissants in the dining room cozy and nice. Great neighborhood to hang out in and also convenient to all Paris. Excellent, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very homely, quaint in good location with excellant service”
Reviews.Author: ronp1954
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel in a great location. Loved the hotel, loved the location, would highly recommend. Travelled with my wife and grown up daughter and chose this hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived the service was first class. Room was quite large and well maintained and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Leave the hotel, turn left and within a minute you are at a square with literally dozens of restaurants and small shops including a couple small supermarkets along the continuing street. Very safe walking at any time of day or evening. A bit of a walk to some of the attractions, Patheon 3 minutes, Notre Dame Cathedral 15 minutes, the Louvre 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Paris charm in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: crucio
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Ecoles was a lovely & homey place to stay. Our room was simple, very clean and a welcome relief after a long flight. No televison in the room but none was needed because there was too much to see in Paris. Since there was a great little bakery nearby, we opted not to try out their breakfast. Great, friendly, English-speaking service. Located just a couple of blocks from the Pantheon and the Metro which was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but nowhere to rest”
Reviews.Author: marginaz
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is in a great location close to buses, metro and sites but I have two complaints. First is that the caulking around the tub (in an otherwise very clean bathroom) was mildewed. Second is that neither the room nor the hotel had anywhere to just chill after site-seeing. The room had a round table with two wooden chairs and a desk with a wooden chair, and while there was no TV (no problem) a radio would have been nice. The hotel's public area consists of the registration room followed by the breakfast room. If one has a few hours between site-seeing and dinner it would have been nice to have a space to sit comfortably to read (take out the desk and put in an upholstered chair). Also, a small notice on the desk in the room politely notified guests that no food or laundry was allowed in the room. Perhaps this is OK for a one night stay, but I was there for 4 nights and missed a homey touch with the ability to have a glass of wine or cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Charming”
Reviews.Author: PatBStLouis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October, and although the room was small, it was comfortable. It was the last 4 days of a 2 week trip and a great finish. Location was the best, we walked to most places and the staff was very helpful in giving directions to places of interest. Daily we left with a map, bus number and instructions for the best places to eat in the area we were headed.
