My first review on TripAdvisor although I've used others reviews over the years, and I couldn't think of a better place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: expatmelbourne
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location-just a short walk to restaurants, markets, transport. Helpful staff, more than eager to ensure a pleasant stay. One of the smallest lifts I have experienced but at least there was one to access upper floors with luggage! Lovely outside area and good security at night.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, accomodating”
Reviews.Author: tinamcbig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles in Oct 2009 and had a wonderful visit. Our plug didn't work, so Marie lent us a plug and a hair dryer. The room was small but charming, with toile wallpaper and crocheted bedspreads and a rather large bathroom. The bed was a queen and the mattress comfortable. We didn't get the breakfast offered at the hotel; instead we walked either to the Rue Mouffetard or the patisserie near the metro and had wonderful croissants. The metro is less than 2 blocks away, and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens are 10 min from the hotel. The Luxembourg Gardens are not to be missed! What a great place to people watch! We highly recommend Hotel des Grandes Ecoles!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous friendly hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RobABalmain
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with clean and spacious rooms - this is a gem!. The staff are exceptionally friendly and make you feel very welcome - thanky ou!. There is a wonderfully lush garden where guests sit during the day and in the late afternoon can gather and enjoy a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Charm”
Reviews.Author: Kathy063
Reviews.Content: It was love at first site as my husband and I strolled in through the cobblestone entry of the hotel. Both the staff’s cordial greeting and the charm of the hotel were all we’d hoped for. Our room was situated on ground level just off the garden court. Although some guides recommend adventuresome A.M. feasting in local neighborhoods, we enjoyed breakfast at the hotel every one of our ten day stay in Paris. As we stumbled out each morning, we were greeted by happy servers laden with silver trays that held hot coffee and warmed milk, croissants with jam, and very crusty baguettes. This was always a perfect start to our busy days of exploring the city. The Latin Quarter provided a great buffer for us between our bustling days of touring. Every evening as we walked through the big green gate-like door to the hotel's inner court, it felt like coming home! In Paris alas! The underground metro was very convenient for getting anywhere in Paris and was quite convenient to the hotel. We were well taken care of by the hotel staff, many of whom have been there for years. I'm sure we will return year after year to this "Truly Paris Experience!"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rikrok
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very clean friendly, a very warm welcome. It was my first visit to Paris, I had heard the hotels are small often dirty and noisy. This one was the opposite to that, it had reasonable sized rooms, very individually decorated and clean. The hotel is in a side street so very quiet, and set back even further in its own garden courtyard. We didn't hear a sound at night, slept very well. Notre Dame is about 10-12 mins walk away. The Latin quarter where the hotel is situated seems a bit more truly french and less touristy than the central Paris. I won't need to look for another hotel when I go back to Paris, I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with great charm"”
Reviews.Author: Salt_City_Sue
Reviews.Content: This is a traditional French hotel with personality. You need to read their web page and reserve ahead especially in summer season. It is not full of TV's and standard necessities of business travel. It has a marvellous courtyard to picnic in and a location within such easy reach of Metro and sights from Rue Mouffetard to the Seine with great local restaurants of all price levels. Be aware that it is not fully a/c which could be a problem as others have pointed out. Enjoy the ambiance and the gates that enclose the court at night.

Reviews.Title: “photos are a cham”
Reviews.Author: peacethroughtravel2
Reviews.Content: After a 23 hr trip to get to our hotel we were not greeted nor told to have a seat and they would be with us in a few minutes. No offer of a glass of water or a place to sit, no help with the bags. We had to wait 45 min to get into our room (we arrived at 12:30 noon). The first room we were shown was tiny and had very small windows and was like a basement, the next room we were put into was on the 2nd floor and had large windows. Neither of these rooms looked like the four rooms shown on the website they are twice as big as the one we had. No air conditioning. Sign in the room saying ' no eating in room'. Front desk staff bored overworked and unfriendly. Poor value as you can have a room with airconditioning and free wifi in the Louvre area for less money and it is CHARMING- not like the grand school which has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and quiet property, not so beautiful a room”
Reviews.Author: raeleen-and-nick
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport at 9am and I was pleased to see the pictures of the hotel on the outside and the gardens were exactly as the hotel's website depicted them. They had a room ready for us by 11:30am, which was much appreciated after a 13 hour flight. A walk to the Notre Dame was 10 minutes, and many authentic restaurants and shops were just around the corner from the hotel. Our room was on the 3rd floor and basic. No air conditioning, some black mould growing in the shower tiles, burnt wallpaper around the furnace...but comfortable bed. The carpet had some animal pee stains in the corners (I think pets are allowed here). Our view was looking at 20 chimneys of surrounding buildings. When we checked out, we waited for 20 minutes while the staff member behind the desk looked me in the eye but continued to listen to an american lady go on about her grandson, what her favorite breakfast was, her bad hair day, etc. Being pregnant and standing in line, it would have been nice to have been acknowledged and told, "this is going to be a while, come back later". Then 2 more americans butted in front of us and asked for extensive directions, and she proceeded to help them. I think this hotel is written up in Rick Steve's books, and he has a knack for finding a quaint little hotel and then marketing it to the masses, which then takes away the "quaintness" of the hotel. (sorry, could not resist a little jab at Rick Steves.) We have stayed in Paris before and found that most hotels are pricey and rooms are small for what you must pay. This one is no different but it has redeemable qualities worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in Paris - loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhodes72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for our 25th anniversary in Paris a few years ago and remember the hotel very fondly. We were well located in the city within walking distance of the river, Notre Dame, the Pantheon, etc. We also had easy access to the metro and dailly had a lovely breakfast choosing from wonderful pastries and then carrying them to the coffee shop across the street near the metro entrance at Cardinal Lemoine. We sipped our coffee while sitting outdoors or just inside the windows if breezy. We loved that the hotel had a private courtyard hidden away in the city with a cobblestone walkway to our room. Our room was upstairs at the end of a hallway. The walls had a lovely floral pattern, the bedspread was a woven white cover and the room had slanted ceilings that added to the coziness. The window opened to a leafy private courtyard. The bathroom had thick tiles and a tub/shower combo. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as we preferred the bakery, but we did carry back a picnic dinner and ate in the courtyard one night. We enjoyed the quiet setting and the location was beautiful within the city. It was unique and not the typical square boxed hotel room. Compliments to this location that remains in my warmest memories. Also in the same neighborhood, we went to Place Contrascarpe, a triangle shaped quaint area of restaurants and shops just up the street a couple blocks and dined on gyros with wine watching the locals and tourists. The room didn't have air conditioning, but it was fine. Tips on things we did in the city: We saw the Marmotten Museum that has great treasures of Monet that are not widely visited by the public - some great water lily paintings, etc. We spent a day in Giverny at the home of Monet, strolled the Tuilleries Garden and had famous hot African hot chocolate at Angelina's. We had a museum day covering Notre Dame towers, St Chappelle, Cluny, Rodin, Louvre and my favorite Musee D'Orsay. We went to the Mouffetard market just down the street from our hotel and saw wonderful produce and locals singing and dancing in the square. We watched toy boats enjoyed by children at the Luxemburg Gardens, spent time at the Eiffel Tower so late one night we ended up on the last Metro run of the night. From Paris we went to Villa Franche du Sur east of Nice for a couple days as well -great contrast and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisien hotel with delightful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Penders65
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July and were very pleased with our decision. The location was great, close to St Michel, the Pantheon and the Jardins de Luxembourg. It was a ten minute walk to Notre Dame or Bastille Square. In the adjacent Rue Mouffetard was a great selection of restaurants and bars, and a traditional morning market. Our room was small but more than adequate, traditionally decorated in toile de jouy. There is no television in the room which we saw as an advantage. The real delight of the hotel was the courtyard where you could sit and read or enjoy a glass of wine in amazing quiet considering the central location. The staff didn't mind us bringing in our own wine from the supermarket, and even fetched us a corkscrew and glasses - no corkage charge. It was great to while away a few hours between daytime sightseeing and evening dining without having to stay in the room or go to some noisy bar. Downsides - although the room was very quiet from the point of view of external noise, there was quite a bit of internal noise from neighbouring rooms, doors and the lift. Breakfast was expensive but optional - there is a delightful boulangerie which does coffee and croissants and has outside seating just 30 seconds from the hotel - we took our breakfast there for 3 or 4 euros a day (for two). I would be very keen to stay at the Grandes Ecoles again because of the location, the charm, the quiet and the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Not even the courtesy of a reply”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyCFleet
Reviews.Content: Sent a booking through their system. No response. Followed up with an email after three days. No response. Sent a fax to enquire if they had received the booking. No response. If their service is as good as their admin, I'd give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: newcastleSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The rooms have no refrigerator, no safe. It is forbidden to eat in the room and to do a little laundry lingerie. No full lenght mirror. I reserved on the phone in February for 4 nights in June and they said they did not have my reservations. I could only stay two nights and had to look for another hotel. The location is out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: breeze_of_wind
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this small hotel Positives -- near Metro, quiet, courtyard, slept well. Negatives -- lift out during all five days of stay -- no explanation, no apology, no offer to help get bags up the 1 to 3 flights of stairs in the hotel. Staff treat you as if you are not there -- they look past you with contrmpt at best. Why the hotel has gone down hill is anyone's guess, but this once charming hotel is now less than charming.

Reviews.Title: “Chambermaid's smile enhances the experience”
Reviews.Author: GreenMountains18
Reviews.Content: My world-traveller cousin stayed at this hotel numerous times, and, of course, recommended it. Persistence gained me 8 days of reservations (booked 5 available days, then kept checking in and got the other three). Our room on top floor of main bldg. was small, clean, and might be a bit warm in summer, but was fine for May. The chambermaid spoke no English, but had the biggest, most charming smile ever, which was a great way to begin our days. Internet connection was spotty, but that may have been my laptop. Here's a tip: they sell internet cards for one, three, and twenty hours. Reasonable, I thought. But I discovered that the cards allow you to log off and back on, rather than expiring after the number of hours purchased. In our 8 days, I used it often, but still had a few hours remaining. Very reasonable. Hotel's in excellent location. Staff always helpful, despite slight language barriers (mea culpa, too). Breakfast at 9 euros is convenient, but you can do better a couple of blocks away. We loved the Thai restaurant a few hundred yards down the street on the way to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis, a charming retreat.”
Reviews.Author: PaulWilts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here to celebrate 25 years of marriage.It was our first time at this hotel and we found it to be a delight.Tucked away in an oasis of greenery it offered peace and tranquility whilst still being close to all the attractions. Our room adjoined adjoined the courtyard garden and it was lovely to have our breakfast outside in the sunshine. We found our room to be of a good size spotlessly clean and full of French character.It was nice to have a bath and a shower with lashings of hot water. The staff were very friendly and attentive to the point of supplying extra pillows when thay spotted we had folden our existing ones double. It was a pleasure to stay in a hotel that was not a cold,clinical affair delivering a service in a corporate manner but somewhere that was alittle quirky in a friendly and personal way

Reviews.Title: “trop charmant”
Reviews.Author: nyakak
Reviews.Content: love love love this hotel. not only is it just around the corner from mouffetard, but it is delightfully deocrated and clean. i love that there are no tvs and the toile in the newer building is too charming for words. other independant hotel owners throughout the world could stand to learn a thing or two from mesdames....

Reviews.Title: “It works for me... excellently!”
Reviews.Author: jbullock47
Reviews.Content: The wide range of reviews of this hotel is proof positive of "Diff'rent strokes for diffr'ent folks". It's true that the rooms are small. It's true that the in-room amenities (shampoo, lotion, etc.) are minimal. It's true that the breakfast is a French breakfast (bread, coffee, juice), not an American one, and it's expensive for what you get. But.... how many Paris hotels can you stay in where you can leave your window open at night and wake up to birds chirping in the morning? How many hotels have a beautiful, secluded-from-the-street garden and patio where you can retreat when you've had one too many metro ride, been to one too many museums and been jostled on one too many streets? The location is great. You are a 10-minute walk from the heart of the Latin Quarter and the metro is 50 meters away from the front door. My only complaint about this hotel is that they do not have window air conditioners for those July/August nights when it is truly stifling in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Clem2000
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights here, and in all of our walks around Paris, we never saw another hotel in which we'd rather have stayed. A great bargain for the price. Everyone is friendly and polite. We never heard any street traffic. There's an extra shot of charm with the courtyard. The WiFi connection worked perfectly. And the little neighborhood a block away, around the Place Contrescarpe, was an excellent place to begin the day at the patisserie, or end the day at any of the cafes, or reload on in-room supplies like excellent inexpensive wine at the supermarche. The Metro stop is not far at all, so access to all of Paris was easy. And even on our long walks, we were very quickly at a lot of great Paris locations, having walked by the Cathedral du Notre Dame several times. Saturday nights buzzes with young people. Very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Shh ... keep it a secret”
Reviews.Author: OsloMusikant
Reviews.Content: Such a charming, romantic hotel. I have stayed there four times, and every time it's like walking into a world of its own, secluded from the noise and the busy trafic. The rooms are rather small, but who wants to spend their time there anyway. And the room rate is a pleasent surprice. Wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic retreat”
Reviews.Author: PetenCarole
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay for a romantic birthday break. No TV, no minibar, no Sky magazines, no lounge/bar with CNN news pumping round-the-clock from a blurry plasma - bliss! Just the birds singing and the occasional rumble of a suitcase down the garden path outside. Could this really be the centre of Paris? For those who can't go without gazing at a screen for 2 whole days, there was wi-fi - but who needs that when you have all the sights, sounds and smells of one of the world's most atmospheric and exciting cities all around you? What the hotel did offer may have been simple, but it was immaculate, very French, and beautifully presented. As for the location, we disagree with those who have described this laid-back and slightly bohemian neighbourhood as touristy. On the contrary, it was a little rough at the edges, full of students and academics (being at the heart of university land) and local characters. One place they gathered was in the cafes and bars in a little square minutes from the hotel. We could dine and drink anywhere, dressed casually in jeans, and feel totally relaxed and at home. The Rue Mouffetard buzzed with colour, smells and life. Gourmet cheese stalls, posh chocolate shops and olive oil delis jostled for space with ritzy student bars and takeaways, fruit and veg stalls, chic fashion boutiques and charcuteries - all of which seemed to be open all hours. But we also explored further. 15 minutes' walk took us to the fascinating botanical research centre of the Jardin des Plantes, and the river. Just over the bridge was the charming Ile St Louis, and one more bridge took us to the Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame - now you're talking touristy! A quick look around there was enough, then over another bridge to the magnificent town hall, the Rue de Rivoli and its many shops, and beyond that, many moe attractions. We just about walked our feet off. But in the evenings, it was good to come back to our tranquil haven in the Latin Quarter. We would definitely return to the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles.

Reviews.Title: “A charming base for a weekend stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: doaknic
Reviews.Content: After scouring the internet for months before choosing this hotel , I was delighted when I finally arrived. Our room was on the first floor facing the courtyard and larger than I had expected . Rooms were very quaint and the bathroom was spotless. Each morning I was woken up by the birds singing on the tree next to our bedroom window. It was so quiet that we found it hard to believe that we were in the centre of Paris. Just up the street to the left is the rue de Mouffetard ,where there is scores of restaurants and bars at more reasonable prices than other areas, We organised our transfers from and to the airport through Easyjet. It was 30 euros each person return by mini-bus. Our transfer was waiting for us when we arrived at CDG and five minutes early for our return for a fast and efficient service. We thought it was well worth spending a few extra euros for avoiding the hassle of trains and metros,and also saved us precious time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: ticklemonster
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 2 families and stayed there twice at the start and tailend of our drive vacation throughout France. I felt that I owe it to trip advisor to do my part since we have stayed in so many nice places after consulting with all the reviews on tripadvisor. So, sorry for the long intro, back to Hotel des Granges Ecoles. The hotel is located in the very charming and best walking neighbourhood in Paris, the Latin Quartier. The location is perfect as you can walk to the Metro (a fair distance but not unmanageable and also nice given the lovely neighbourhood). The reception is efficient and as the hotel has its own parking,it is very convenient if you are with children. The hotel has its own garden, so the kids can safely run around. The rooms are charmingly decorated in lovely french theme and colors. Despite its location, the rooms are really quiet! Hot water shower was good and bathroom came with bath tub which the kids love to soak in esp during winter and when you have walked so much visiting the many sights in paris. There is not lift/elevator so you have to carry heavy luggage up the stairs, so ask for lower floor rooms if you prefer not to deal with heavy luggage. There are tons and a great variety of restaurants & takeways literally 1 min away at reasonable rates, and you can dine with kids. The supermarket is also nearby. The breakfast at the hotel was 9 euros which includes good hot choc / coffee, juice, delicious croissant and generous servings of bagette and butter and lovely confiture/jam... Well, everything is perfect. The Bon Marche is only a few metro stations away and the Museum Natural Histoire is somewhere in the same side of town...go early though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful staff, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: randyNewtown_PA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a couple minutes walk from the Sorbonne, Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens, and Notre Dame. The hotel is in a quiet, picturesque courtyard. The rooms are attractively decorated and very clean. The staff is as helpful as can be. And best of all, the price is very, very reasonable. The rooms are small but that is the norm in Europe. I don't know if there is a better deal in Paris but if there is, I'd like to know about it. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Hotel Grandes Ecoles”
Reviews.Author: michelesteve
Reviews.Content: Sorry to disagree with the other reviewers but this is a French Motel 6 in disguise with nice wallpaper. Most of the rooms are on the tiny side. We requested a large room and were given a mouse-size room. There are no toiletries except slivers of soap. There are no tissues. The bed is a bit lumpy in the middle. The drinking glasses are plastic cups. How cheap can you get? The garden is pretty, but we weren't going to sit there in January. We had to change rooms, hump our bags across the courtyard and up a flight of stairs with no help--and we are in our 60s. For the last two nights of our stay we will have to hump our bags again to another room. This place is long on charm and short on reasonable amenities! It is also out of the way of the major attractions. You have to take at least two trains to get to the major ones like the Louvre, etc. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming”
Reviews.Author: KelStar824
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in September 19th - 22nd, 2008. The hotel had some problems with our reservations. I was traveling with my parents (same last name) and we booked 2 different rooms, separately. When we arrived at the hotel they only had one room available under our last name. They confused our reservations, thinking that we were the same person, an honest mistake. Thankfully we both had email confirmations of our reservations and within a couple hours (and a yummy breakfast that they gave us), they came up with another room (as the hotel was full). This room, we believe, is not normally a room they rent out. It was in the back lower portion of the hotel and was basically a small apartment, with a kitchen and living room. My parents stayed in that room, so I can not speak on their behalf. The room I stayed in was in the main building where the lobby and breakfast room is located. I can not remember the room number, but it was on the 4th floor, I want to say 416. The room was well appointed and very clean. A comfy queen sized bed with a beautiful bedspread. The walls were covered with cherub wallpaper. Each side of the bed has a nightstand with lights and a telephone. There was also a table with 2 chairs by the window, which had a great view of the buildings in the area. The closet was big enough for my large suitcase and all my clothes with room to spare. The bathroom was a really nice size with a big tub and shower. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, but as I soon found out is not very strong and I have long thick hair, so it took about an hour to completely dry my hair. There was no clock in the room, so I recommend bringing a small travel clock. The front desk can arrange for a wake up call – which I recommend because it plays cute music including Happy Birthday :) There is a small elevator, which just fit myself and one suitcase – I am not a large person! I used the stairs most of the time. Like I said when we first arrived and there was the confusion with our rooms they gave us a complimentary breakfast, otherwise we had breakfast one other time when we were in a rush one morning and didn’t have time to walk around and find a café. The coffee was strong but good and served with warm milk (a nice touch). The breakfast is not the typical American eggs, bacon and pancakes. It is a piece of French bread, a croissant with jelly and butter. I definitely recommend going to one of the many bakeries in the area and getting a ‘Pain au chocolat’ which is a croissant with chocolate in it… very yummy! Eating breakfast inside is nice, but if the weather allows, take advantage of the tables in the courtyard. A nice feature is that with your room key is a key swipe device that allows you inside at night, as they lock the big green doors after a certain time (I think it was around 10pm). I felt very secure knowing that no one besides people staying there was allowed inside at night. When I was leaving, I planned on taking the metro back to the airport as we did when we were arriving, however and thankfully, Marie at the front desk, while I was checking out, asked me how I was getting to the airport and advised that parts of the metro were not running because of a strike. She then made a few quick phone calls and got me on a shuttle taxi that picked me up at the hotel in time to catch my flight. I am forever grateful to her for that help! All in all, this hotel is beautiful and made my trip to Paris very enjoyable. After long days of walking and sightseeing it was a wonderful place to retire. Even with a few bumps in the road with the reservations and departure, I was able to enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Paris”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer28
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is tucked away behind tall gates on the Rue de Cardinal Lemoine. A small sign is the only thing indicating its presence. Upon opening the gates, one finds oneself in a lovely garden courtyard. Very welcoming. While our command of the French language certainly improved during our stay in Paris, we were initially hesitant and unsure of our communication skills. The hotel staff were most gracious and helpful in this regard. They encouraged our attempts at French, but were also very capable of helping us in English. We soon found ourselves in a delightful, third floor room with a beautiful view of the courtyard below. The rooms are small, of course, and very clean. The beds comfortable. There are no televisions, no radios. It was explained to us that this is because the hotel is very old, and the noise would be potentially disturbing to other guests. The bathrooms are clean. Some have tubs but most are shower equipped. Toilet paper was sometimes insufficient and you might want to bring your own Kleenex as it seems to be scarce in Paris. Location is good. Latin Quarter is charming and bohemian. Walking in the neighbourhood is a pleasure. Metro close by. Patisseries on many corners. Incomparable pastries. They truly are works of art!!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: EduBrazil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute. Quartier latin is a good place for tourists. There's people of everywhere in there. Asians, europeans, latins, russian, africans. It's a mix. A facility to the brazilians: Marie, the proprietary, is portuguese. There is a street near the hotel with several (thousands) restaurants. On the Cardinal Lemoine there is a very good turkish restaurant. Backing to the hotel, the rooms are not luxurious and very adorned, but have a simplicity that I like. I liked too that there wasn't TV on the rooms. The bathroom is okay. There is not a shower, just a bath. The bed is good. Just a problem on the room: I am atopic, with allergic rhinitis and suffered a little with sneezing, stuffy nose and tearing eyes on the 4 days we stayed there. I had to buy a polaramine to stay in the room. The price is good, worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the area”
Reviews.Author: twinkie57
Reviews.Content: Have not stayed in this area before, usually in the st. Mich area or Opera but I found it very interesting to be in a place that also had plenty places to eat and drink but we found the prices inParis sky high and not just because the pound is weak against the euro. The hotel was very nice, large clean room but it suffers from nowhere to be in the evening, not everyone wants to be out all the time. Staff were helpfull arranging journey to airport . A little Toile de Jouy goes a long way! twinkie

Reviews.Title: “Garden Surprise”
Reviews.Author: txhawki
Reviews.Content: Very good value. Small but clean rooms. Friendly staff. Quiet garden for relaxation. Ask for room in back as street can get noisy. Walk to many nice cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: julieros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights in October 2008 and absolutely loved this hotel. We had one of the rooms in what I am told is the newest part of the hotel (or newly renovated). The bed was larger than any we've ever had in a European hotel, as was the bath, and the room was very charming, opening up onto the courtyard. We never heard a speck of noise. The staff are all extremely nice and helpful. I would say that my only regret about this hotel was not having discovered it sooner on one of my earlier trips to my favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, fun, value!”
Reviews.Author: elfperson
Reviews.Content: I watched the tripadvisor reviews of this hotel obsessively for months, and they were accurate. The hotel was just about exactly as I expected, even better in some ways. I hope my review and photos will provided the kind of info I looked for myself. First, to get it out of the way, the only negative thing--and something I had worried about after reading other reviews--was a reservation hitch. When we arrived, we were told our room would not be ready until the next day and we'd be spending the first night in a different room. This was not awful; the room (on the garden level) was lovely though smallish. The only annoying part was that we couldn't unpack yet. The "real" room was indeed ready the next morning, early enough that we didn't have to wait around. It seemed to me that there was quite a bit of this room shuffling going on, but I didn't notice anyone upset or ruffled. Our "real" room was upstairs along the cobblestone walkway. There was a bit of noise from other guests' rolling luggage and voices but nothing intrusive. Next time, I'll request an upstairs room off the courtyard instead--maybe a bit prettier view, though I have no complaints about ours. Our room, 147, was much larger than I was expecting (and I strongly recommend paying the higher rate for the better/bigger rooms--the rates are so reasonable that it's worth a little stretch), with a little alcove with a couch, table, and chairs and two big windows. Pretty wallpaper, very comfortable bed, good linens (changed daily), clean modern bathroom with shower (good water pressure), decent-sized closet where we fit all of our stuff (except for the empty suitcases). The hotel staff is very helpful, including offering advice on restaurants (we highly recommend La Volcan, just steps away--we went twice), calling taxis, and so on. The breakfast was fine: croissant, baguette, coffee, juice. We took it maybe half the time, mostly for the convenience. The courtyard was beautiful; we had a great picnic dinner on our first night, with food and drink collected at five different shops on nearby rue Mouffetard, a fun market street. The Metro station is close and convenient. Also nearby is Arenes de Lutece, an ancient Roman arena now used as a public park by young soccer players and not-so-young boules players (and beer drinkers)--a fun slice of Parisian life. Ernest Hemingway's first Paris apartment is right down the street, and a place where James Joyce lived while finishing "Ulysses" is next-door to the hotel I hope to return to this hotel many times. I'm recommending it to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with your favourite aunt”
Reviews.Author: Barbara064
Reviews.Content: This was a very good place to stay. The room we were initially allocated was a "garden room" - sadly, it was a very dark ground-floor room, opening onto a pathway with other guests and staff walking past so we couldn't have the doors or window or even curtains open. So we asked to change and we were swapped into a second floor room which wasn't flash, but still, fitted the bill perfectly with the auntie wallpaper, a small double bed, nice crisp linen, and an adequate bathroom - and we felt very comfortable there. We could sleep with the windows open to the pretty courtyard and the lovely cool September air and it was all very nice. Technology seems to have passed them by - no CNN or BBC for English-speaking relief at the end of a busy Franglaise day and, goodness me, no internet. We had to flounder around to find one of those nasty internet cafes with grubby keyboards and letters in all the wrong places. The hotel is in a lovely area of Paris - you feel you are coming home at the end of a day of Paris-watching. The staff on reception were, thank goodness, English-speaking and very helpful. There's a laundrette just a few metres from the front gate. We loved Teddy's Bar which is close to, if not beside, the laundrette. Also enjoyed buying our morning coffee and pastry from Madame at the little boulangerie in the corner of the nearby square. We managed to find the metro eventually. Definitely an above-average experience in Paris and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Lovely and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: redheadjeanne
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles about 5 times and each time has been a gem. The rooms are pleasant and the staff very helpful. The garden is welcoming and the breakfast room very sweet. This is a family - run business and not backed by any sort of corporate entity, so there are some rough spots, none of which would ever keep me from returning. Some folks have had trouble with reservations, but I never have. When I am certain i am coming and have specific dates, I follow their website suggestions to the tee. I send an email as early on the 15th of the month 4 months ahead requesting my dates. They send an email back confirming availability and requesting a credit card. They don't actually use the credit card unless you're a no-show. I've also sent an email when my dates are more flexible and I've missed the deadline -- do you have 4 consecutive nights in June? And I've had some success with that. The reservation complaints have subsided, I think, and they may have been caused by the transition from their old pencil and paper system (that defied all understanding) to a computer-based system. Can't recommend this place highly enough. Just warm and fun and well located. But it doesn't have the amenities of a chain hotel (which is what I like about it ... I bring my own soap and shampoo). p.s. While a lot of guide books suggest eating breakfast at a cafe to save $$, we love the 9 E breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Romantic Hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DanielAndRachel
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this romantic hotel tucked away in the Latin Quarter; here are some highlights. Cute courtyard/garden, helpful staff, typical French/Parisian decor, great location: 3 minute walk to Metro, 2 min. to plaza with shopping, restaurants, etc., 3 min. to Internet cafe, within walking distance to Pantheon, Sorbonne, Cluny, and the Seine. Insider tip: room 114 has a large balcony and is bigger than other rooms (but it doesn't overlook the courtyard).

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: We were at Hotel Des Grandes Écoles for 4 nights and we really enjoy this place. The location is very convenient in Latin Quarter. The hotel is not directly on the street so it is very quiet. There is a very nice court to relax, have an apero or breakfast. We were in room 135. It was big enough, quiet and spotless clean. All the people working at the hotel were nice and smilling. Really, there is nothing to complaint about this accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay helped by wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: christiansunderland
Reviews.Content: A short, three night stay at this hotel was made fantastic by the exceptionally friendly and wonderful staff, they were an absolute joy. The room was comfortable, a decent size and very clean. A beautiful secluded courtyard where breakfast can be served makes this a real gem, excellent value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great local hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesSingapore
Reviews.Content: Great relaxed hotel in 5th, walking distance to Rue Saint Germain and Notre Dame one way and close to local restaurants and markets. excellent ambirence, clean, staff friendly and welcoming... a family establishment. Well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for staying in the Latin Quarter without spending a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: GaryInSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were nice, although small (which is usually the case in Paris). It's a good location. There's a nice garden. The staff is very helpful -- I lost a button on my suit jacket, and asked one of the staff members if there was a place nearby where I could get it sewn on. She said that one of the maids could do it, and she did -- saving me time and effort. Two small caveats. Their air conditioning seems to be minimal, which could be an issue in hot weather. While it's close to a metro line, it's not one of the better metro lines. You need to make at least one connection to get to the main tourist attractions. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and perfectly Franch”
Reviews.Author: drnorth
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. We had a room that opened directly onto the beautiful garden courtyard. We awoke to bird song. Our room was tiny, but charming and cozy. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was available in the lovely breakfast room, or in the courtyard on warm days. The location is terrific. A short walk from so many wonderful sights and ares and only about two blocks from the metro. Because it is so near the Pantheon, it is very easy to find. I can't think of a better place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Wee Gem”
Reviews.Author: Fillup
Reviews.Content: highly recommended-great hotel in great location- book it now!!! i stayed in this hotel based on recommendations from TripAdviser posts.. a great little hotel hidden away from the hustle and bustle of Paris.. it's not too glam or salubrious but if you just want somewhere to retire to after a days sight seeing this is the place to go. it's clean and great value for money. we had very little interaction with the staff so i can't comment on them but htey seemed friendly enough (during our weekend in paris i never encountered any of the infamous rudeness- i must say i was a little disappointed) we didn't eat there, there's a square around the corner from the hotel and we had our breakfasts there instead, a bit pricey but you go to paris for value and what better way to enjoy a morning coffee than sitting on the terrace watching paris waking up for another day of chicness??? The only things that may put a body off staying are that the rooms are basic and small, the floral print wallpaper is not to be looked at when hungover (and they have covered every surface in the room with it) there's no TV or any of that modern nonsense but when you've the city of lights as a backdrop who needs the telly??? None of these bothered us in fact they added to the charm of the place and i'd deffinelty try and book it again the next time i'm in paris but judging by its popularity on TAdvisor i'll probably have to book a year in advance.... i found some grat bars and restaurants in the area too if you want to message me about them

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Setting within The Latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: sfpd192
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles has been a favorite hotel of my parents for as long as I can remember. My parents always make it a point to stay there on their many trips to Paris. My wife and I stayed here for the first time and were very impressed. The buildings that make up the reception and rooms are off the street down a quiet, private courtyard, which leads to a fantastic garden ripe with shady trees and outdoor patio tables. Despite its location in the heart of the hectic Latin Quarter, the nightime noises of the revelers is non existant. Our room was nicely appointed and very spacious with a modern, and large bathroom. The hotel was close to many recommended dining options and needless to say we did not have a bad meal in the area. There are also plenty of bars and cafe's within two blocks of the property to unwind after a long day of sightseeing. If the bar scene is not for you, the garden was constantly packed with patrons reading quietly and sipping glasses of wine which could be bought at the convienence store one block away. Most of the main attractions of Paris are within a few miles walking distance and there was a Metro station two blocks away from the hotel which easily transported us to Montmarte and the Sacre Couer. If you are looking for a modern hotel this is not the place for you (I.E. No television in the room.) However the value we received to stay in such a lovely hotel was fantastic (we paid 130 Euros a night.) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is lucky enough to spend time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoneStarHeaven
Reviews.Content: We accidentally arrived 2 days early in Paris and could not get into our rental apt for another day. We called the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles and were told there was a room available. It was lovely as were the grounds. It was such an oasis in the midst of Paris. We highly recommend it. Since the hotel does not have air conditioning, it would have been better for us in a 2nd-floor room to sleep with open windows, but that is a minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “+Lived up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: JoanParis2
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were in Paris for 4 days, 3 nights early March. We found tthe Grandes Ecoles on TravelAdvisor and were torn between it and another hotel. No regrets whatsoever on choosing the Ecoles. Charming, charming area - close to all sorts of eating establishments and close enough to walk to Notre Dame and Louvre (I am 76 year old sr. citizen and my cousin is just pre-sr. citizen age). Rooms were lovely - clean and spacious. EVERTHING worked the way it was supposed to. Felt perfectly safe in hotel and around area. Would recommend highly!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Loved It! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: kimi74
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful, close to transport, has a lift, friendly staff, clean rooms, is close to all attractions, has great information on tourist opportunities and was wonderful. It was my first time to Paris and we were so tired coming in. But the staff at the hotel were so kind and patient with my awful french. The bed was so comfortable. The view from our room was so french and it was quiet. The location was great! Close to bakeries, restaurants, cafes, groceries shops, transport, and tourism sites. I loved this place so much and would recommend it to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “warm and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sarclavier
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter just returned from 5 days in Paris, and highly recommend Hotel des Grand Ecoles. We choose the hotel by reading reviews in TripAdvisor and agree that Grand Ecoles has a great combination of location, price, charm, and lovely helpful staff. It was perfect for a mother-daughter trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: marts1475
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for the perfect Hotel in Paris. I went back and forth between location and hotel stars, and trip advisor reviews. It took me two months to make the decsion. Finally I went back to my very first choice which was this hotel. It was exactly as it was described. A perfect garden, signing birds, and clean lovely rooms. It was two blocks from many cafes, quiet cobblestone streets and the Pantheon. The metro was 4 minutes walk down the hill. The satff was helpful and the place was all around perfect. The bathroom was a normal size as were the rooms. I was expecting Teeny-tiny rooms and it was just a normal size. We were there for 3 nights before traveling to Bordeaux. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet peacful hotel that is a clean, three star, close to the metro, walking distance to cafes, and reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: EAKB
Reviews.Content: The charming courtyard makes a great first impression. Loved this place. Great staff, lovely breakfast room, clean & comfortable rooms. My room was on the first floor right near the lift, so I heard a bit of coming/going noise but it didn't worry me. Great part of town, too - close to Metro, walking distance to the Seine, near to lots of great restaurants. I felt like a Parisian staying here. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “quite little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: diaden2
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff. Very quiet area. Nice area with a variety of choices for dining. Easy walking distance to Pantheon and Sorbonne. The rooms are small ,but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Useless”
Reviews.Author: TheHanoian
Reviews.Content: Planning our trip to Paris in summer 2008 and heard about the HOTEL DES GRANDES ECOLES through the tripadvisor community. Tried to book as early as 6 months in advance but were told by the hotel that they only accept reservations from a certain deadline onwards...Deadline came, we resent our reservation, only to be told that they are fully booked for the period we wanted to stay there...Might be a charming little gem in the heart of Paris, we will never find out, but their reservation service certainly sucks! (By the way, it seems to be impossible to book this hotel through any of the usual internet booking agencies...)

Reviews.Title: “They screwed up our reservation”
Reviews.Author: 2FatOldMen
Reviews.Content: We have not stayed yet at the Grandes Ecoles, but we had been hoping to, on strong recommendation. They confirmed by email, but 24 hours later announced they had made an "erreur de planning (de mois)". Very irritating given that I had made non-modifiable travel plans in the time between acceptance and cancellation. Are they to be trusted? Should I persevere with them?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful refuge”
Reviews.Author: LGR12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful refuge from the big city. The garden is a fabulous place to eat breakfast every morning. The rooms are on the small side but quiet. The bathroom was a little funky - the tub was very high to get in and out of - but adequate. Great location as well, very close to Rue Mouffetard. I thought the staff wwere helpful as well. The only downside for me was that there were so many other Americans!

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful chintz and chocolates”
Reviews.Author: Oxondon
Reviews.Content: No longer such a well-kept secret, but still a little gem in the 5th arrondissement. In fact, you'd be hard-pressed to find any French accents in the building, since when we were there (over Christmas 2007) it seemed to be full of Tripadvisor readers from the US, UK or Australia! Cheerfully chintzy, clean and good value accommodation, amazingly friendly service levels for Paris and enormously accessible (20 mins from Eurostar by metro): oh, and free chocolates on Christmas Day morning! We were travelling with 11-year old son - room for three had a curtained off area for the extra bed. If you get TV withdrawal, the hotel now offers very cheap wifi. Five minutes walk from the Paris botanic gardens, if you like that kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic setting!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelDallas
Reviews.Content: Truely, a hidden gem. My wife and I celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary at this little treasure! Just a couple of blocks from the subway. The wooden gate at the street opens to a cobblestone walkway that leads you to the wonderful courtyard and beautiful gardens. The staff is excellent and helpful. the first three nights we were fortunate to get room 29, ground floor, large room with extra large bath and king size bed. There are no televisions but this is Paris!! There is so much to see and do that unless you are on a very extended stay you will not miss television. Wonderful shops and restaurants are close by and most have english menus if needed. The last two nights we had room 114, a lovely room, a little smaller but through the french doors you were led to a large private balcony that was delightful!! I would recommend this hotel highly. Very much a Parisian feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at this quaint garden hotel”
Reviews.Author: marnie_g2001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in a spacious nicely decorated double bedded room with an ensuite on the 2nd floor overlooking the garden courtyard at 135 euros per night. Breakfast was available each morning in the salon or courtyard and was very nice. Some mornings we opted for a coffee shop or pattiserie closeby for a change. The courtyard is a great place to open your bottle of wine on a nice afternoon after a great day out. We loved the location of the hotel, close to metro station Cardinal Lemoine and also walking distance to Luxebourg Gardens, Pantheon and Notre Dame. The hotel is easy to get to via Eurostar station/Gare du Nord to metro station Cardinal Lemoine plus 5 minute walk uphill. We love to walk and the restaurants and cafes of San Germaine & San Michelle were always alive with lots of locals and tourists. The hotel is in in a great neighbourhood amongst apartment buildings and there are mini supermarkets, hairdressers, coffee shops and delicious pattiseries, little boutiques and restaurants. There is a village type square to the top of the street with bars and restaurants which were a buzz at night. You can either use the Metro or other transport to get around. We enjoy walking a lot so we walked to the Champs /Arc di Triomphe/ Eiffel Tower. This was our first trip to Paris and we visited all the major tourist attractions. We would definately stay in the Latin Quarter again and definately at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Escape in Picturesque Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust111
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this quaint hotel. I couldn't figure out before I arrived how it could be as quiet a garden scene as it looked on the website. But, it was! It's basically got its own little carless street, accessed by a doorway off of a small street in a very picturesque part of old Paris. The gardens were lovely. Besides the quiet serenity and the gardens, the great thing about this hotel is its location. We loved the neighborhood, especially Rue Moufftard (gourmet haven on a tiny, windy, street) and Place Contrascarpe. The rooms were nice. We stayed in 125E/nite rm. 29 for 1 nite (door off the garden) and 115E/nite rm 111 on the 1st floor 2 more nights. One downside was that if you are staying on a garden level room, there is no way to get air circulating into your room without risking your security by opening the little window next to the door. A person could slip into your room using this window. This place is challenging if you have a car, but we didn't. And, at 115-125 E per nite, it's fairly spendy...but, that's just Paris for ya! Enjoy! Paige

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: It is so nice to come back to a place and like it even better the second time around. Our room (242) is on the top floor, with two dormer windows opening into the courtyard. We had two twin beds pushed together. I agree that it looks like the bathroom has been recently renovated. It has lots of room and storage. I would have liked a bigger walk-in shower but that is a minor quibble. I wish that the hotel took reservations earlier than six months ahead. It is so popular that it is a bit nerve-wracking to have to wait to see if you can get in. Nothing more to add that hasn't already been said. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional comfort and value”
Reviews.Author: psychlone
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Grandes Ecoles and was as pleased this time as last. The price and location are unbeatable. The rooms are pristine, a bit cutesy but give you the feeling of being in Paris, not a North American Hotel. The beds would be smallish for a 6ft North American man I think, but the women i have travelled with were very happy. I was surprised to find that it now has Wifi but happily no TV or radio. We walked everywhere, but when the metro is required I recommend walking accross the Isle St Louis and taking the Metro from the Right Bank. I wonder if grandmere is getting a bit deaf because you always get full breakfast even if only cafe is desired. But she is so sweet and accomodating it is a small thing and can be overlooked easily.

Reviews.Title: “terrific value”
Reviews.Author: KevinfromKent
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this lovely hotel. Great room overlooking courtyard (nos 45) with comfortable twin beds plus sofa bed. Good bathroom. Fantasic price (135 Euros). Only negative was no TV but if you have watched French TV you will know this is no great loss! Quiet despite central location. Easy walk of the Jardin des plantes, the river, Notre Dame, Patheon etc. Lots of restaurants nearby. Good breakfast with delightful waitress. Car parking in secure garage (30 euros a night). A previous review talked of a dirty room - this must have been a one off as our room was clean, fairly recently decorated and very comfortable. A real oasis of peace, calm and comfort in a great location at a terrific price. Was in two minds whether to post this review as this hotel is such a bargain I would hate for it to become over booked or for the owners to decide they can raise prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Kim9599
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our 2 day stay in Paris. It was in a good location close to a metro and nice restaurants. We asked for a room overlooking the courtyard which was very quaint. It was back off the street so noise was limited and we felt very safe (only people with room keys could get into the courtyard after a particular time). The bathroom looked recently been renovated and was very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris (but maybe not in the middle of summer since it doesn't have air conditioning).

Reviews.Title: “Birdsong in the middle of Paris?!”
Reviews.Author: rcs67
Reviews.Content: We were amazed to wake on our first morning at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles to hear birds singing in the courtyard. This was the kind of surprise we found throughout our stay. From the wonderful shower in our bathroom to the multi-lingual staff, everything was just a little bit better than we expected--even though the hotel had come highly recommended by relatives. Just up the street from the hotel is the Place de la Contrescarpe--restaurants and bars are easily in walking distance, without feeling like you're trapped by tourists at every turn. And down the street there are grocery stores and patisseries (and the Metro!). The wallpaper in our room was a little busy, but our room came with a fan, a great big window into the courtyard, and a comfy bed--who cares about the wallpaper?!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NorthFloridian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris last year and again this summer; so I have some perspective on the value of this hotel. I read reviews from this site and reviewed Fodor's guide book. From the guide, I contacted a few hotels in the Latin Quarter. This hotel responded very promptly and gave a written confirmation of the booking. The price was reasonable. I took the metro from the airport and got off at the Cardinal Lemoine station. I had no difficulty whatsoever becasue the confirmation included exact travel information. That was invaluable. I only paid 8.5 euros for the trip one way. The walk to the hotel was easy and along a well lit public street. The entrance to the hotel is secured behind garden walls and absolutely beautiful. The pictures from their web site are representative of the property; so there is no dissapointment. The registration porcess went smoothly. My room was lovely. I was pleasantly surprized by the spaciousness of the room in comparison to last year's accommodations. The room was as tastefully appointed as the public areas of the hotel and had a view to the gardens and courtyard. I looked at other rooms just in case I might want to try something else on a next visit. All of the rooms were nicely appointed and spacious. My room was advertised for one to two persons. The property was pristine clean. Bed linens and towels were what would be provided in a highly rated hotel. Room lighting was above par. Electrical outlets were strategically placed. The shower gave a generous water stream. I traveled alone and felt secure with treatments to windows ,and the courtyard was locked at the street. Guests have access via keys and intercom. One major reason for selecting this property was its proximity to attractions that I wanted to visit. I did not want to spend time or money in city travel. Maria (I think), at the desk was wonderful - as were all of the staff. I cannot imagine how anyone could rate the staff to be unfriendly. She gave me a personalized map of Paris with sites already marked. All sites were in walking distance with streets well marked. I had no difficulty visiting the Sorbonne, the Pantheon, the Garden of Luxenburg, and Notre Dame among other sites. I have no time to write more; but I know what kinds of questions I had and have tried to provide answers for those of you still shopping. My advice is to book early. My only complaint is that my visit was too short. I will remedy that the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, Unhelpful, Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: marjNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This was once a great budget find. This time, the room smelled of body odor. They were full so there was no other room. Something bit me (mosquitoes, lice, bedbugs ?) the second night. I told them I could not sleep another night in that room. They charged me for the third night anyway. Such a shame the management is so bad.

Reviews.Title: “What a Paris Hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: fromTorontoTravel
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed at this hotel last year - we left our husbands and kids at home and decided to see Paris from a ladies' point-of view. We originally planned a stay of 12 nights but decided to shorten our Paris adventure and head to the Provence area for a few days. I gave the hotel two-week notice of our change of plans and received an immediate confirmation and OK from the front desk. We took a shuttle from the airport which was a great move - great value plus we had the benefit of the friendly, experienced driver acting as a tour-guide, pointing out all the great spots of interest around Paris. The Hotel courtyard that greeted us was spectacular! Check out all the posted pictures - the courtyard is private, beautifully landscaped and oh, so French. The check-in was smooth, we had a comfortable, nicely decorated room on the second floor with a great view of the courtyard. Now, we did not go to Paris to watch TV or hang out in our room so we immediately set out to scope out the neighbourhood. To our great surprise, we discovered Rue Moufftard and it's market and shops with Cafe Marc serving one of the best and least expensive coffies in Paris. We found a seat every time we visited (there is no take-out coffee here - sit and enjoy). While strolling, we ate a croissant or a goodie from one of the numerous neighbourhood bakeries so breakfast was always exciting and new. I thought the breakfast at the hotel was pricey so we just found other alterernatives. For lunch, we again picked up something from the market and ate back at the hotel in the lovely courtyard, surrounded by the lovely scents, bird songs as well the the sound of the childrens' choir coming from the nearby school. It was fabulous! The location of this hotel is ideal - we walked everywhere (resulting in a 10lbs loss in weight for each of us during our 2 week stay in France): The church of Notre Dame, the Pantheon, Luxenburg gardens, thousands of shops and restaurants of the Latin quater... Upon returning to Paris after our trip south, we had to stay in another nearby hotel - it was more expensive but what a dump by comparison! Please don't complain about room sizes or hospitality in Hotel des Grandes Ecoles until you've seen other Parisian options, and we did see at least a dozen - yuck! We so wished that our "Gem of a hotel" was again available but they do book up early. After all, it keeps appearing as one of the best values in Paris in many of the Travel books. We both agreed! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LondonerinFrance
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by friends and it didn't disappoint. It is in a perfect location - walking distance to all the main sites and surrounded by markets and restaurants, yet when you go through the large gates into a beautiful garden courtyard, the hustle and bustle of Paris is left behind. The rooms are bigger than average and are very French (ie. floral). Book well ahead and try to get a room away from the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: wineshipper
Reviews.Content: I know this review is long coming considering the time elapsed, but better late than never. At the time of travelling to France to spend 5 weeks experiencing all regions, ( I'm in the wine industry) a French work colleague warned me to stay in one hotel only, so who should question a frenchman? He did not disappoint. Like all reviews before close to everything, but it has the real french feel that you are looking for. So relax and let the atmosphere wash over you. Salut

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Michele13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights in early May -- in room 109, which was a corner room on the second floor that overlooked the courtyard. The hotel entrance is tucked back off the street, just off a flower- and tree-decked courtyard filled with several bistro tables. It was such a peaceful place -- but so close to all of the sights and cafes and crowds on the Left Bank. The rooms were very clean, the bathrooms quite functional -- but our favorite part was the courtyard. It was the perfect place for a mid-afternoon snack and a bottle of wine. The front desk staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Word of mouth wasn't wrong”
Reviews.Author: Geelong_traveller
Reviews.Content: Over many years friends have visited this hotel and this time it was our turn and it was great. Quiet inside the hotel and delightful courtyard surroundings but plenty of Parisien life outside the gates and cafes where you can sit and watch the world go by. The welcome was friendly and helpful , the rooms a decent size, the beds comfortable and good bathrooms. Perhaps I shouldn't say this because next time we go it will be booked out! We will continue to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hotel des Grandes Ecoles for 5 nights last spring. My husband and I had a double bed while the kids shared a pull-out couch that seemed quite comfortable. The room was a good size for 4 people from what we expected in Paris. We had a desk built into the wall and a small table with 2 chairs where we had our breakfast. The bathroom was clean and modern complete with a hairdryer. No issues with bed bugs as I had read. Our room was near the entrance (on the first floor) yet it seemed quiet. If you go left out of the hotel, there is a cafe diagonally across from the hotel where you can get cafe au lait to go (granted it is in a plastic Heineken cup that will burn your hands if you don't walk fast). First I would get croissants at a local patisserie and then the coffee. It's a nice area to stroll around and yet close enough to the sites that you can go back for an afternoon siesta if you choose. Nice place - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_travelling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles for 4 nights with my daughter and niece. Our room was spotlessly clean and serviced everyday. Hotel is a delight and very well priced. Sure there isn't a tv but who cares when you are in Paris. Many excellent restaurants are just a very short walk away. Staff were pleasant and helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel or indeed stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably priced, snobby”
Reviews.Author: ebern
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, well located, no frills hotel in Paris, this might be a good choice. It's in the lively Latin Quarter, close to lots of great restaurants, and just a block from the Metro. The price is right. However, it's loud in the morning, the breakfast is unimpressive, and they do not seem to have gotten over the stereotypic French snobbery. We had a problem with our bathroom and were yelled at and humiliated for this. Not our idea of customer service. They also interupted our afternoon nap to clean our room, rather than cleaning it in the late morning. We felt more like unwelcome house guests, than pampered customers. They did not even say "Merci" when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel des Grandes Ecoles experience”
Reviews.Author: bostonpage
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 7 nights at the Hotel de Grandes Ecoles and have fallen in love with both the hotel and with Paris. Our room on the third floor overlooked the courtyard, with wide windows that opened out letting in birdsong, the sound of nearby church bells, and a wonderful, elusive fragrance that we couldn't identify. We could only bring ourselves to close the windows when the wind drove the rain into our room, which was very comfortable and charmingly decorated. The bathroom was attractive as well, with a fine in-tub shower, scented soaps and shampoos, a hair dryer and plenty of towels. True there is no television, radio, or mini-bar; but those are items we do our best to avoid on vacations, so that absence goes in the plus column for us. The breakfast is essentially what we would term a continental one and not worth the 8euro each; although, again, it is charmingly presented. We preferred to buy delicious pain au chocolat from a marvelous little boulangerie in Place Contrascarpe, a two minute walk away, and bring them back to a table in the lovely courtyard. It was a challenge that we could not meet to locate any place that could provide take away tea, but we discovered that we could purchase it from the hotel for 3euro. worth it for a habitual tea drinker! The staff were pleasant and helpful, the price a reasonable 115 euro for two. This hotel will definitely be our Paris location on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, Not Expected”
Reviews.Author: MahaHouston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent area, very close to everything. The rooms were clean and the courtyard was quite enchanting. However, it was simply a very nice place to sleep and nothing else. The breakfast is overpriced, and the rooms are tiny, especially the triples. The room contains neither radio alarm clock nor television, so if you need these forget about it. If you want a nice clean place in a good neighborhood and do not care about luxuries, amenities, etc then it is ok. I wouldn't not stay there again, but I wouldn['t go out of my way to stay there again either.

Reviews.Title: “True Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: chrisCarlsbad
Reviews.Content: The location in the fantastic City of Lights was perfect for my husband and me. We literally walked to all parts of Paris, and when out of energy, headed for the nearby metro. Nothing was difficult to manage. The ambience of the hotel and the neighborhood made us feel like we were living in Paris, not just visiting. The very French decor, the personalities of the innkeepers, and the delicious breakfasts were excellent amenities. The room was charmingly decorated, very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The only downside to the hotel is that the bedroom floor-space was limited, which made for difficult luggage management, and the bathroom was also small. But we figured it all out and coped just fine. I would highly recommend this hotel for discriminating people who want an authentic "old Paris" experience rather than the large hotel experience. Chris Ross

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Princeton_Man
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe the last reviewer and I stayed at the same hotel. My wife and I just returned from four days and I have to say it was as terrific as so many dozens of American travellers and travel writers have said. Yes, the rooms are smaller and the walls are not sound-proof. That's true of all older hotels in France. And in this hotel, there are big differences room-to-room. We were first offered a room on the ground floor, but it had only a double bed - too small for us. When I asked for a different room with a bigger bed we were offered something on the second floor that was bigger, had a queen size bed and a full size tub/shower in the bathroom. Big difference -- same price. We stayed in room 134. It was at the end of the upstairs hallway and had a big window that opened over the beautiful central courtyard. When you reserve, ask for an upstairs room. The breakfast was surperb. We didn't take it the first day because the area is loaded with fabulous bakeries. So on the first morning I ventured out in search of rolls, fruit and coffee to bring back to the room. Alas, it is very easy to buy any kind of warm fresh baked good you can imagine in this neighborhood. But they don't sell coffee at the bakeries. One needs to go to a cafe -- take out coffee in paper cups is unheard of in Paris. So the next two mornings we took the petit dejuner at the hotel. The coffee is about the best I've ever tasted --rich and dark --and the croissants were freshly baked. The location is an oasis in a very lively neighborhood at the Rue Mouffetard, packed with cafes, bars, stores and hundreds of pedestrians -- mostly a student crowd. There is a jazz bar around the corner that made noise until about 2 AM on Friday night but was quiet on Saturday night. A few other tips - The Rue Cardinal Metro station is closed for at least the next few months for repairs, which meant we had to use the Jussieu stop and go up the hill on Rue des Boulangers. Taxis - Unlike NYC and other big cities, one cannot flag down a cab on the street in Paris. You need to have the hotel call for a cab or go to a taxi stand. The nearest one to the hotel is at the junction of Blvd St Germain and Rue Monge - a decent walk. We also got to and from the CDG airport on the RER line B using the Luxembourg station on Blvd St-Michel. You get a great view of the Pantheon on this walk and the neighborhood seems very safe. This was a big savings over a $60 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Can't figure out why this rates 3 stars - I'd give it 2 at best!”
Reviews.Author: therier
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed in this hotel, especially after reading the reviews. Granted, it has a lovely courtyard with flowers, trees and seating, but there are signs everywhere asking you to keep it quiet as there are rooms off this courtyard. Besides, I'm not in Paris to sit in the hotel courtyard, no matter how pretty. The walls of the rooms are paper-thin: I heard the elevator (next to my room) all night long, and when the couple next door came in late, I awoke with a jerk positive that someone was in my room (they were not being noisy). The bathroom had one of those narrow folding-door showers where if you drop the soap, there is no way to pick it up with out shutting off the shower and getting out. No tub either. The best linens ever experienced in a French hotel (better than some 4 stars) and the pretty room did not compensate for the thin walls, lack of television, and poor shower/bath. Two other major problems for me: neighborhood and the petit dejeuner. At the petit dejeuner, which was an extra charge, store-bought hermetically sealed in plastic danish are served, which is a sacrilege in Paris! The neighborhood is deserted most of the time - being behind the Pantheon and next to the Paris Department of Buildings. There is no where for blocks and blocks to buy a bottle of water and the local ethnic restaurants are mediocre at best, mostly serving as late-night hangouts for students to smoke and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Abroad
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel!! My mother and I greatly enjoyed our visit at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles in Paris. The rooms are extremely charming and comfortable, the bathroom clean with great water pressure, and the staff considerate and helpful. We love Saint Germain and the Latin Quarter, and the hotel is perfectly located. We hope to return again and again! For affordable and delicious dining, we recommend Le Petit Princee on Rue Lanneau, Eric Keyser Bakery, l' Estrapade near the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: kamiahkid
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Ecoles is an amazing value in Paris! This inn is a little secret hidden in the Latin Quarter of Paris. It was a perfect place to stay for our first visit to Paris. The location is within walking distance to three metro stops as well as Notre Dame cathedral. There are many good restaurants, patisseries and cafes nearby. The neighborhood also has a good vibe with many students attending the local universities. We didn't have breakfast at the inn as there are many places in the neighborhood to stop off and get a wonderful pastry and coffee. I highly recommend staying at Hotel Grandes Ecoles, and my wife and I will definitely return in the years to come. Please e-mail michael_r_higgins@hotmail.com if you would like photos of our room, which overlooked the garden courtyard or other tips about the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, convenient, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: gkendric
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at this hotel through the web, and had no problems with the reservation at all. The location is very convenient to the Metro (1 block up from the Cardinal Lemoine station), easily reached from the train station (we came on the high-speed Thalys train from Belgium) and yet the hotel is amazingly quiet. It's set back from the Rue Cardinal Lemoine by a tall gated wall, and has a lovely courtyard garden. Your room key opens the outside gate for coming back to your room after 10:00 pm. We had a quad room, with our two teenage children staying with us. The price for this 4-person room was very fair at 150 Euro per night, which was slightly lower than quotes at other lower-rated hotels in the Latin Quarter. Our room was on the third floor, in a corner of the building facing away from the street, and had large windows opening onto both the garden and the entrance walkway, plus a private bathroom with shower. The two beds consisted of a queen size bed and a pull-out double bed from a couch, but they were suitably comfortable. The room also included a small table and chairs, plus adequate closet space. It was very clean and well maintained, and the bathroom was spotless with plenty of linens and soaps. Although it was not air conditioned, there were two fans in the room, which we didn't need due to an unusually cool week in August (low 60s at night). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and were quite patient with my destruction of the French language. We did not take the hotel breakfast, but instead opted for croissants from patisseries along the way at much lower cost. We were also able to store our bags in the lobby/office after checkout for several hours until our train departure. The location is simply wonderful, less than a 10-minute walk to Notre Dame, two blocks from many restaurants and shops on the Rue Mouffetard, and two blocks from the Pantheon. There are plenty of small cafes and brasseries nearby, along with a small supermarket, ATM, and creperies for snacks or lunch. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is seeking a clean, comfortable, and quiet place to stay in the left bank. We will absolutely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation confusion”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I waited for the required time per the hotel's booking procedure to make a reservation. I have read so many good things about this hotel and its rate and location are excellent. Everything went well with the resesrvation process. However, I needed to revise my dates and emailed the hotel by forwarding my confirmation email they sent to me explaining that I needed to revise my stay from three days to two. I received no reply for two days. I resent the email and finally they same person who confirmed my reservation, Fabienne, responded. Instead of revising the dates as I requested plainly I received a new reservation offer for the three original days.
