Again I sent another email explaining the same request about revising the dates only and that I do not need a new reservation as I already had one and to check the reservation records for my name. I received a reply saying they could not open the attachment I sent, but I didn't send any attachment. I explained once more my request but again I received another reservation offer but this time for two days! By this time I became frustrated with the whole ordeal. I could not understand why my simple request was not understood properly. I thought perhaps there is a language barrier, but then I understand from previous guests' comments that the front desk lady is fluent in English. I ended up canceling the reservation in full as I didn't want to be charged an extra night in error. Unbelievably the same lady, Fabienne, emailed me a cancellation confirmation immediately. It's amazing how she understood that email very well, but couldn't understand the previous ones. Sorry, but I prefer to stay at a hotel that has staff who responds properly to a guest's request.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: seandubh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in February 2006. We flew into CDG and the hotel was easy to find using the metro. The staff were very friendly and eager to help (even when I asked to borrow a needle and thread - using dreadful French). We did not have breakfast. The hotel is central and quiet but the surrounding neighbourhood is lively at night. There were several good restaurants within 5 - 10 minutes walk and we always felt safe walking at night. Our room was an average size - ground floor - perfect for our needs. This was our first visit to Paris and I felt we made a very good choice. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Cruising-along
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles in early May. We loved it and will definitely stay there the next time we go to Paris. We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and pictures, and we liked it even more than we thought we would. We booked as early as possible and asked for a room overlooking the beautiful garden, which we got (Room 137). We have no complaints at all. Since our stay was in the spring, we did not miss an air conditioner, and we certainly didn't want or miss a television. Who needs a television in Paris anyway? We had more than enough shampoo, soap, etc. and the room was good size with a queen-size bed. The room was very clean, quiet, and had plenty hot water. We chose to eat breakfast at local, nearby cafes. Rue Moufftard is close, with their excellent street market, and there are lots of good cafes within walking distance. We ate at Le Petit Cardinal several times. Hotel des Grandes Ecoles is my idea of what a hotel in Paris should be. It is full of charm, from the beautifully decorated rooms to the lovely flowerbeds in the central courtyard with the tables and umbrellas where guests can relax. The staff at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles couldn't have been more gracious and friendly to us. Madame offered written directions to different sights, and made phone calls for us, checking on the hours and days certain places were open. Maman is a sweetheart, posing for pictures with me and so patient with my halting French. We cannot recommend this hotel enough, and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Seven times at Grandes Ecoles and wanting to go back again.”
Reviews.Author: Textibb
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles seven times since 1998 and have come to love it more with every stay. The rooms are comfortable, the staff is welcoming (in that slightly aloof but still appealing Parisian sort of way) and the location is great -- close enough to everything to make touring easy, but just far enough away from the tourist center to have the feel of a real neighborhood. But the garden is the main glory of Grandes Ecoles. After an exciting, but tiring, day in busy Paris, going into the GE garden is like taking a trip into the country. We usually make our visits in October just as the leaves are turning gold. What a pleasure opening our shutters in the morning and looking out into the autumn glory! On our last visit we took three other couples with us and all are still thanking us for sharing our "secret" Paris hotel with them. Now, I suppose, we'll have to start booking even further ahead, since the "secret" is deservedly out.

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect ...”
Reviews.Author: overseaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Situated in a quiet and traditional neighbourhood. The room was big enough and modestly furnished. Great bathroom. No TV, no minibar, no ice machine, traditional (poor) french breakfast, no newspapers. But friendly and stylish (with flower wallpapers). With a little more comfort and service, this hotel could be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Très agréable!”
Reviews.Author: ellenv
Reviews.Content: We (couple, English, late 40's) and daughter (16) have just returned from 3 nights at the hotel, and wanted to address some of the issues raised in the few negative reports we've read. Shower gel/shampoo, soap and a hair dryer were provided. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the shower. My husband and I are both 6'2" (1.88) and our daughter is 5'10" (1.78); our rooms (on the top floor) were perfectly adequate in size, although if we'd been staying longer, we might have wanted a bit more sitting space. The garden is lovely, but the weather wasn't conducive to sitting out. However, with several cafés a stone's throw away, we weren't bothered overmuch. The lift is somewhat snug, but we didn't find the stairs too taxing. Breakfast, we thought, was fine - a hot drink, fruit juice, a large croissant, what seemed like half a baguette and a pot of jam each - but there are plenty of cafés in the neighbourhood serving breakfast (though not much cheaper than at the hotel) and plenty of boulangeries, a market in Rue Mouffetard and a little supermarket in the square up the road for a DIY breakfast. The lack of a TV is a positive advantage; no noise from neighbouring rooms! And most kiosks sell English language newspapers. In summary, a pleasant, clean and comfortable hotel in an excellent location, with very agreeable staff. We'd certainly stay there again. Oh - and we simply picked up a taxi at CDG airport; the taxi queue was easy to find, and was marshalled. We were quoted €45 for the ride into town but were, in fact, only charged €39. On the return journey, the hotel booked us a shuttle for €55.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: Jim007
Reviews.Content: Found this place in the 2005 Rick Steve's Guide Book and could not be more pleased. Stayed here twice and can't wait to get back. It's a great location along with being a nice, quiet hotel with a VERY helpful & nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol1945
Reviews.Content: This is our second year staying at this hotel. We love it. The garden and patio area are so beautiful. The rooms are lovely. The staff is very friendly. The metro station is a short walk. There's a beautiful square two minutes from the hotel with cafes and restaurants. This hotel is what I thought a Paris hotel should be - quaint and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: BenoitChartier
Reviews.Content: Rooms larger than average for Paris, quite clean despite some seriously chipped paint on the bathroom ceiling. Location is excellent, price is very reasonnable. Entrance inside a garden is a bit unpratical for loading /unloading luggage, but it is charming. No TV is no problem: hey, you're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous place !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a family of six people from Finland and spent the Easter of 2006 in Paris. We always check the tripadvisor hotel reviews before we decide the hotel where we want to stay in, The hotel Grandes des Ecoles had great recommendations. We did not get disappointed. The location was great in Latin Quater, just 5 min walk from the metro station Cardinal Lemoine, 15 min walk to Notre Dame, close Panthenon and Sorbonne. The Latin Quarter is full of nice restaurants, cafes and bakerys. We will absolutely choose this hotel again when we will return to Paris, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Tulsan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at Hotel des Grandes Ecoles with my wife and 2 daughters and we loved it! Our room was smaller than some of the other quads, but still more than adequate. We passed on breakfast (preferring to make a daily run on a nearby boulangerie), but I had them send a carafe of coffee to our room each morning, which was very good and reasonably priced (as compared to the (very hot) dixie cup I received when I requested a "grand cafe to go" in a nearby cafe). While it is slightly off the beaten path, who really wants to try to sleep on the beaten path anyway? Very convenient to the Metro and the wonderful Rue Mouffetard area (we liked it better than Rue Cler) and a 10-minute walk from THE premier kid attraction in Paris (with apologies to Disney)--the Luxemburg Garden and its wonderful playground! For the location and cost, I can't imagine the HGE being beaten.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: loie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles - March 1-10, 2006. I haven't stayed in too many hotels in Paris, but I can't imagine a better or more charming place to stay. The location is perfect. Walked to Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, Concierge and Pantheon. Many charming restaurants in the area. The metro is located one block away. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Marie is the best, giving directions, making reservations etc. The room was delightful;decorated in French country. Room and bathroom were immaculate. I can't recommend this hotel strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EllenMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles for 10 days in Feb., 2006. The hotel is quite charming, but the rooms are small. We had to upgrade from the room they put us in since the original garret room was too small for us to open both our suitcases! The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated and well-cared for by the family who own and run it. Breakfast is available at 8 euros which we though a bit pricey. We found a cafe nearby on Rue Monge and had our croissants and cafe cremes there each morning. The hotel is well situated for touring Paris and close to Metro stops and many reasonably priced restaurants. There is, however, no internet access and we found it a challenge to find easily acccesible internet cafes. I loved the charming atmosphere, but my husband found it a bit over the top for his taste. I consider this a pretty good value for the going rates in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tennisguy22
Reviews.Content: SL is a very welcoming place. The staff is always willing to go out of their way to make the customer satisfied and happy. The hotel is impeccably clean and maintained. The food is very good (though not gourmet). There is a very nice continental-type breakfast available free each morning. The location is good, being about 1/2 mile from the downtown in a safe section of town. They provide good help with tours, laundry, and transportation. The prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming garden hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvandor
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Ecoles is actually three separate buildings situated around a cobblestone courtyard with carefully tended gardens. You enter the courtyard through huge green doors, which are closed at 8pm and afford more privacy and security. The rooms are decorated in french country style. Our room (#221) had cute blue etoile wallpaper with matching curtains. It was clean and comfortable and the hotel staff was helpful and patient with our terrible french (or lack thereof). Its location is a little out of the way but, consequently, it is very quiet at night. I would highly recommend this little gem for your next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here three times!”
Reviews.Author: LorieM
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel--charming old buildings facing a private garden/courtyard. My husband and I keep returning to this hotel over the years and we've met others who do the same. The rooms are well decorated, clean and quiet. You would never know that this hotel is in the middle of a great city. Breakfasts are great, too. It's a great value and convenient to the Metro, Luxembourg Gardens, Rue Mouffetard, the Place de la Contrascarpe. The staff is courteous and helpful. Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles has made our visits in Paris very, very special.

Reviews.Title: “u”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 nites at this hotel and found this to a charming, cute and tucked away rendevous place in Paris. However, beware the rooms are small and the bathrooms were also small, however you can make doo and if you do not hit a heat wave, you will be quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - great value”
Reviews.Author: Fijman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oct and really thought the hotel was a great value. You can't beat the location or the price for what you get. The room was nothing spectacular but it was clean and had everything you would need. Note - no TV but who needs it anyway when you're on vacation... The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hideaway, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: This is such a nice hotel I almost don't want to recommend it in case it is full up when I next want to go! But I got the details off Tripadvisor...so I guess I have a bit of a duty to add my comments too! It was really delightful. I would always recommend it. Very quiet, very pretty even in November, both inside and out were restful and charming. The heating was extremely good, we were warm and cosy. Staff were so friendly. This was almost like a b & b in atmosphere, the check in is a room with a big old desk, paperwork kept to a minimum, family photos everywhere. The area is charming and we walked most places, we do like walking however and if you don't like to walk, then the metro station of Cardinal Lemoine is nearby, also the rather more useful Luxembourg RER station is about 15 mins walk. There was nothing I didn't like about this hotel, myself, but there are a few things which may perhaps bother some people so are worth mentioning. First, there is no TV, no minibar, no bedside phone, none of those hotel-like things, didn't see any internet or guest lounge or bar. Just a room, albeit a prettily decorated one with lovely view over the garden which was still colourful in November. The breakfast at 7.50 Euros wasn't as good as I expected although it was okay, whereas the rest of the hotel was so charming I'd kind of expected the breakfast to be sensational instead of just ok. The little soaps were a bit ordinary, and bathroom a bit cramped. However it was very clean the beds were comfortable and seemed new, there was a tub not just a shower, nice towels. Lots to do nearby. We had quite pleasant evening meal at the Restaurant Verlaine in rue Descartes where Verlaine died AND Hemingway lived. Thats just around the corner. There's a veggie - wholefood restaurant very nearby, quite unusual for paris, and many other places to eat and snack and sit around

Reviews.Title: “Fun Location”
Reviews.Author: Bratty_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before leaving via Charles deGaulle. The room was smaller and not the category we had reserved, but we were charged less. The property is easy to find and has an attached garage - very handy if you are driving, which I do not recommend. The room was worn but comfortable. Definitely would not stay here if you want an air conditioner, service or access to TV. They do not have these. Price was good 105 Euros/night for a double room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the garden location..but beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Though a lovely hotel and garden upon checking out we had a problem getting a taxi.. and were told to go down the street and get one ourselves as the taxi company was not answering the phone. We needed to catch a 10am train to Amsterdam. I felt this service was unacceptable. Also they never provided the wake up call..We did make our train via the metro. Just beware if you need to make an important transportation connection.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: bostonoski
Reviews.Content: It's beautiful, tucked away, very quiet, LOVELY room, pretty courtyard, good breakfast, very nice bathroom... in short: terrific. And I actually was THRILLED *not* to have a television in my room! Very happy I listened to several friends and family members who had stayed and loved it. Great quiet neighborhood with few tourists, yet so close to the Pantheon, Jardin Luxembourg and easy Metro access. Could walk right down to the river as well. A bonus: the night staff (students?!) are VERY friendly and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with very friendly staff, all day singing away as they worked. The room was small but clean. The hotel garden area is great. The hotel is located within a short walk of alot of restaurants. We went to le volcan, which was a great and very affordable restaurant, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to stay!”
Reviews.Author: activeteacher
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Rick Steves guide book and were thrilled with everything about it. The location is hard to beat, with plenty of places to eat or buy food, good shopping and the metro stop that connects with every place you want to go. The hotel staff, without exception, were pleasant and eager to please. I requested a first floor room and that did not pose a problem. The rooms are small but charmingly furnished with large bathrooms, hot water, good beds and plenty of towels. My daughter the travel agent says this more of a a "bed and breakfast" hotel, as there is no TV, lobby or bar, but that is just what we wanted. And the price is terrific. Five of us celebrated our 60th birthdays there last April and were able to enjoy the newly blooming garden, so I imagine that in the summer, it is beautiful and restful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect retreat in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pip4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel largely because of the excellent reviews we had read, and we were not disappointed!! It is so pretty and peaceful, in a wonderful location and we were made to feel very welcome by the friendly staff. The breakfasts in the courtyard were the icing on the cake, a wonderful way to start the day! The selection of restaurants and cafes nearby were excellent too. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Struck Gold.”
Reviews.Author: MBarr
Reviews.Content: Planned a trip to a few European destinations through the web. Paris was our last destination and had stayed in some dissapointing hotels. The Grand Ecoles was a breath of fresh air with clean rooms, a lift, private bathroom in a quiet and secure settings. Location is perfect between two metro stations, surrounded by cafe's and restaurants and a laundry across the street. Breakfast in the garden is the perfect start to the day. I wanted to arrange a special night at the Eiffel Tower for my wife and reception handled all the details. They also gave us restaurant recommendations and every single one was perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: pnc87
Reviews.Content: After being warned by friends that a quiet hotel in central Paris would be impossible to find, we discovered this charming place. We shared a quad room with our two teenage daughters and felt the room was bigger than we had anticipated. I thought the matching wallpaper and curtains added so much olde world charm - very Parisian. The room and bathroom were clean and the beds comfortable. Our room looked out over the small garden and rooftops of Paris and was just beautiful. Even with the window open at night there was no noise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent and we managed to walk everywhere. It was close to two Metro stations and a ten minute stroll to the Notre Dame and the Seine. Parking is available in an underground carpark on the premises which was a bonus. There is a huge choice of restaurants in the nearby Rue Mouffetard and a Laundrymat and Internet cafe is located across the road. This charming hotel really did contribute to our enjoyment of Paris and we will definitely be staying here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With two other Australian couples we stayed 4 nights at the HGE late May/early June 2005. Two of the rooms were 105 Euros, and we took the available 120 Euro room which opened out onto the cobbled leafy courtyard. All the rooms were absolutely lovely, but ours was larger with a capacious bathroom. All had table and chairs. The toile wallpaper, lace bedspreads, bathrooms with new perfect tiling and fittings could not have been bettered. Having visited Paris 9 times over the years, this is a little gem. With friendly welcoming staff, charmingly decorated rooms, spotlessly clean, we had no complaints at all. The bar over the road became our 'club', and the friendly barman allowed us to take our drinks back to the impeccably tended courtyard garden on a promise we'd return the glasses. We enjoyed baguettes, croissants, and coffee both in the charming breakfast room and in the courtyard. With a handy laundromat next door to the bar, we could sit with a coffee while we waited to clean well travelled garments. We enjoyed attempting to speak French with Madam and her friendly helpful staff. Convenient to the Metro and many restaurants, (check your guidebooks for up to date recommendations), this is definitely the best hotel we've stayed at in a big European city for true charm, style, character and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: MUR5RUN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days the end of May into June. We had a triple room with everything we needed. Perfect time as we didn't need AC. Grant you, its not 5 star but we were very pleased. When you come off the street, you enter into your own little court yard. The people are very friendly and helpful, rooms were cleaned every day and beds were quite comfortable. We did not go for the breakfast there as we fell in love with a patissere(?) and coffee bar down the street. Also, within walking distance is Moufettard(?) - lots of food, good prices!!!! Also, the Mo is right down the street and we even jogged to the Seine. Everything was so convenient!!! I would love to stay here again - everything was just so easy!

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time”
Reviews.Author: rpmcestmoi
Reviews.Content: This is a relative (I stress the relative) bargain with a nice location for those who like the left bank. Near a great market street (rue Mouffetard) and a downhill run to Isle St. Louis. But it has seen brighter days. Perhaps it is the ever more business like character of the operation as rooms are added and the cosst escalates. It's warmth has faded as had its rooms where a broken fixture from a re-do in 199-something stays a broken fixture, and the green stair carpets needing replacing are not replaced. On the bright side it has a great location and a lovely courtyard where you can sit and read the newspaper before setting off on your day of walking. I lov e the neighborhood, the morning visit to Papeterie Descartes for Liberation and a chat with M et Mme Dran. Just as is la petite from Poland who has worked at the hotel for a number of years now. You will know her from her smile, her small size, and her humor. They are the real thing to be treasured.

Reviews.Title: “Fab visit”
Reviews.Author: meddam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HGE May 24th-31st. The room was a standard (#110, in main building) & the rate was 105 euros/night. It was decorated in blue toile with a closet, bathroom with standing shower, double bed & a table with chairs. The room was very clean (as was the rest of the hotel), although the chairs were a little worn. There were huge windows that opened up to the courtyard. Marie was very gracious and the staff were all very nice. We chose not to eat breakfast there, but I often ran down to the patisserie at the corner (near metro stop - with the same guy & his dog there everyday - you can see them in the photo) for pasteries, or went to the Champion grocery store on Rue Monge around the corner for fruit (one note - you weigh your own fruit & put the sticker on the bag). Close to 3 metro stops (cardinal lemoine, jussieu & place monge). Took RER B3 from hotel & changed to line 10 on way in from CDG, took RERB3 directly from Luxemborg on way out. I really liked this hotel (although I have nothing to compare it to since it's my first trip to Paris). The courtyard got a little loud sometimes & the hotel requests that you not hang out there after 10pm (or at least not make noise) - although some guests disregarded this. The room was smallish, but adequate & the shower was tiny. If you dropped something in the shower, you either had to squat to pick it up or open the doors so that you could bend at a 90 degree angle. But the water pressure was good & lots of hot water. Walls were thin & there's no airconditioning. If you think it will be hot while you're there (which it was for 2 days of our stay) ask the front desk for a fan. I know they have at least 1 since another guest requested one. Also, if you have hair that needs a serious blowdryer, bring your own. I could have run around in circles & gotten my hair to dry faster! Overall it was a lovely stay. We enjoyed picking up snacks from the supermarche up the street & reading in the courtyard. Close to lots of restaurants & Rue Mouffetard has some interesting stores. I'm already thinking about when we can go again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located with easy access to the metro and a nice garden. Lots of cafes and restaurants around it. However, this hotel does not offer any bathroom amenities. NOTHING! The towels are freyed, old and completely worn out. They most definitely need to be replaced. Our double room consisted of two very narrow single beds put together. Breakfast is very skimpy and highly over priced. Will not use again.

Reviews.Title: “Country Inn feel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_F_Smith
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles! The hotel is very clean and reasonably priced, and the staff, for the most part, very helpful and fluent in English. We awoke every morning to the sound of birds chirping outside our balcony. The private courtyard was a nice oasis in which to enjoy a cup of coffee and some pasteries from the excellent bakery (a block away) before a long day of sightseeing and a bottle of wine afterwards. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance of many of the key sites in the Latin Quarter and along the Seine, not to mention some excellent restaurants. The area around the hotel is bustling with students and other hip youngsters in the evening and night, yet the hotel is incredibly quiet throughout. The only complaint I had was that the walls were thin, which meant that you could hear the elevator going up and down. This is a little thing, but I did find it a little irritating at the beginning. On the whole, however, we were delighted with the hotel and look forward to our next stay. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, wonderful, would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: malpal
Reviews.Content: Dear daughter and I stayed here four days in June of 2003 - as part of daughter's graduation present. Originally, I didn't even want to include Paris in our three weeks in Europe, but daughter convinced me that to go to Europe without being in Paris was akin to going to New Orleans and Not hearing Jazz!! Sooo .. upon advice of folks on the travel board, we chose this hotel. And daughter was so right right to include Paris. It was nearly perfect! The owner and her daughter were more than congenial and very helpful (especially the day of the metro/bus strikes!). We had made reservations to store our car in the garage where the car stayed our entire viist. The hotel was close to Everything..the metro, the bus lines, Notre Dame, etc etc. The reason I said "nearly perfect" is because our room was off an alley that had non-stop traffic (pedestrian and auto) all nite long. We were sleeping with our windows open because it was so very warm. We had known there was no a/c, but thought that as long as we could open the windows, we'd be ok. We know, now, to ask for a room couryard side! Truly a wonderful experience overall. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Enjoyable and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kirkrik
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel after reading a couple of negative reviews. But my nervousness evaporated after walking into the Grand Ecoles' beautiful little courtyard. There we found other guests relaxing in the garden - drinking wine, eating cheese, reading - and all of them had a pleased look on their faces as if to convey: "Hey, you found it too! And isn't this nice?" The staff was quite pleasant, I tried out my French, and they gladly answered in English. I had done my homework and had emailed for a second confirmation just before we left the States - and they promptly responded. Everything moved like clockwork. Our room was very nice - a little sparse for furniture, but clean and comfortable. (We had plenty of hangers and pillows) The wallpaper and matching drapes are funny and (to me at least) uniquely French. And although one reviewer complained about the lace bedspread, (c’mon, who complains about a lace bedspread?) it was not an affront to my sensibilities. The bathrooms were also clean, and although compact, everything worked fine. And yes, they didn't provide shampoo - but (to paraphrase one of the negative reviews) who comes to Paris for hotel shampoo? One afternoon, we purchased some wine and savory tarts from the nearby shops on Rue Mouffetard and brought them back to the courtyard. The staff had a corkscrew and some glasses for us to borrow. It was a nice April day, and we felt like we had our own private garden. One more thing - Since the French tradition is to eat late, every night we got back to the hotel after the courtyard was locked. Our special key got us in, and it was nice to close off the bustle and noise of Paris behind a big wooden door, and quietly walk up the cobblestones to our building's entrance. We felt very safe and secure - like it was our home. We'll gladly stay at Hotel des Grande Ecoles again.

Reviews.Title: “good price, location and value”
Reviews.Author: AndiColumbia_MD
Reviews.Content: With the dollar so weak we really scoured for a reasonable hotel, as we needed two rooms, one a quad. I read here on tripadvisor that there were some booking problems so I triple emailed them with confirmations. We really loved it. Other reviewers were right, there's no tv or shampoo, and the towels are a bit stiff, but the garden was lovely, it really was a quiet oasis and the rooms were pretty, quiet and clean. The location was great for us, and we didnt find the uphill walk from the metro a problem, even with one handicapped traveller. We ate all of our meals on the Rue Mouffetard, just a block or two away, and had great fun with all the choices within walking distance, and especially loved our greek dinner. I think it was a good value and perfect for what we were looking for, a clean attractive quiet reasonably priced place to see Paris from. (Note we took other travelers advice and brought our breakfasts at the local merchants instead of eating in and saved LOTS).

Reviews.Title: “Ask For A Big Room”
Reviews.Author: RamblinSal
Reviews.Content: I think there may be some nice rooms at this hotel (across the courtyard from the main buidling) but we sure didn't get one. Extremely small room (double bed only) and as another reviewer mentioned no amenities in the bathroom. How this hotel got three stars from the French bureau is beyond me. My boyfriend is 6'6" and I'm no slouch at 5'8" and there was literally no place for us plus our bags. And no place to unpack anything -- a total of TWO hangers in the closet! We had to leave the room to change our mind! We were booked for 6 nights but beat it out of there after one sleepless night. And the busy wallpaper pattern with matching drapes was something out of a bad 1950's movie. Not to mention the lace bedspread, lace table cloth and doilies on the nightstands. Truly a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “A ripp-off at Grandes Ecoles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A real ripp-off, extremely overpriced. The rooms and beds are very small and unconfortable. You have to bring you own shampoo and earplugs are advisable too if you don't want to be disturbed by the other guest. The only good thing they have is their backyard, but who goes to Paris for a backyard??? For this kind of money it's easy to find a far better place to stay in Paris. The only thing you probably won't have then is the fake romantic feeling the Grandes Ecoles pretends to have, but who's waiting for this?

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: blue_kazoo
Reviews.Content: With a hard-to-beat location and garden setting, we most enjoyed our 6-night stay at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles. The staff is extremely friendly (especially the breakfast servers), and we found the room to be very clean and surprisingly quiet for a hotel in the city. If you are looking for lots of amenities (TV, etc), you won't find it here, but if you seek good value in a charming and peaceful small hotel close to the metro, excellent restaurants and small streets perfect for strolling, I highly recommend it. I only regret it wasn't warm enough to take coffee in the garden, but that's Paris in March!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous !!!”
Reviews.Author: Elise B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 2004 for 4 nights. What a wonderful little find. Absolutley beautiful little rooms, lovely clean bathrooms and a woinderful oasis of a garden. Don't bother having the breakfast here, we ate out at one of the many cafes nearby. It is in a central locations with a myriad of restaurants and bars. Also close to many of the lovely parks. Thorpoughly recommend this hotel to anyone.!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel des Grandes Ecole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Paris France on Friday 04/02/05. Spent 4 nights at Hotel Des Grandes Ecoles in the Latin Quarter. This hotel is in an excellent location for all your sightseeing. The rooms are small and very parisien, they are cleaned every day and breakfast is at a supplement if you so wish. We had a lovely time staying here, there is a lovely courtyard to the front and it is very safe and quiet. From our hotel we were only 5 mins walk away from the Pantheon and only 10-15 mins walk from Notre Dame Cathedral. We walked everywhere in paris including the Sacre Coeur, never had to use the metro underground. Our hotel was within walking distance for bars, restaurants etc, highly recommend La Vulcan, food was superb along with the price €44 euros for two people for 3 course meal, drinks not included but they don't start serving until after 7.00pm. If you are staying in the Latin Quarter and are looking for a pub at night and your french is not the best then go for a quiet drink to The Fifth Avenue Pub on Rue Mouffetard. The barman Roddy is from Glasgow and is a real gentleman, we had the best of craic with him and the other barperson Annmarie from Dublin was lovely. They have satellite tv and show all the big sport events. Its best to shop around for snacks during the day. For breakfast outside of the hotel find yourself a columbas cafe, two teas and croissants were only €6 euros for two, we paid double that elsewhere. We also used the Le Marche FranPrix supermarkets they were very reasonable for sandwiches drinks etc and then eat them as you walk along or there are plenty of nice places to sit and watch the world go by. If you are going to the Sacre Coeur walk through the Opera District and up through Montmarte it's absolutely beautiful don't take Boulevard Sebastopol, not nice at all. Beware of the guys at the bottom of the Sacre Coeur who will try to stop you and sell you bracelets made from wool strings for €5 euros a piece, its a rip off but they do it with such charm, that you aren't aware until its too late. Do try to speak the language whilst you are there, in our experience the french really appreciate it if you at least try, even if its incorrect. They will speak back to you in English if you get into difficulty. We only had basic school french but it got us by PS Recommend the Paris Shuttle from Charles De Gaulle airport to the door of your hotel, service was excellent well worth the extra few euros. Traffic in Paris is an experience all of its own, an absolute nightmare especially around the Arc De Triomphe. Paris was everything I thought it would be and more, a truly romantic city and the architecture was superb, we had a great few days there.

Reviews.Title: “cute, not a bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very cute hotel, but rooms are tiny with no tv, radio, etc. Decor can be a bit much- matching flower wallpaper & bedspread. The bathroom was rather large and very clean. The breakfast is nice and service a bit quirky, but definitely not a bargain. I don't think I would stay here again for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and just returned from a 6 day stay at this hotel and loved it. It is more like a B&B than a hotel (which was great for us). It had all the charm that we expected. The rooms were simple but clean. While the amenities were few (no TV, no clocks, no shampoo), the atmosphere was perfect and quaint. (And plenty of hot water.) At first, we didn't like the lack of amenities. But as the manager said, "now you have to talk to your wife" and it proved to be very calming. The location was very calming and interesting at the same time. The local Place was filled with great restaurants. A metro stop was a block away. Grocery stores were convenient as well as creperies. The only negative was the breakfast. It was not great and we decided to bring in breakfast each day. We bought fruit, croissants, yogurt and juice. It was half the price and a much better breakfast. That being said, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mcollier
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for a week and loved this hotel. Close to Metro and Notre Dame. Rooms are sparse but comfortable. Just up the street is a brasserie where we had cafe au lait and baguettes every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: monicafern
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine from work recommended this hotel and I stayed there in February of 2004. It's a charming place in a quiet courtyard off the street, but near the heart of the Latin Quarter. I'm not surprised this hotel is so popular. Book far in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Really no need to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: tonymsrad
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly staff. Small but quaint rooms. Beautiful entry. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Grandes Ecoles oasis!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, Sister and I spent ten days in Paris, five of which we stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles. The next time we will book the entire vacation at the Grandes Ecoles. What a wonderful little oasis! Very quiet, serene, and comfortable. The garden patio gave us an opportunity to chat with other visitors over wine and snacks in the afternoons. We exchanged up-to-date recommendations about what to do and what to miss in Paris. Thank you for the recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Hate to say it - but this is easily the best value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At this Hotel, there is no city noise - just a beautiful courtyard garden and singing birds. It is in a lovely location, with a local bar and restaurant area only a few metres up the hill; a great food market on Saturdays just nearby and a short walk down to the Seine if you want to stretch your legs. The rooms are roomy with nice outlooks over the gardens. It is not the latest in decor, but charmingly French country if you know what I mean. The owner, a lovely elderly Frenchwoman, ably assisted by a girl who has alway worked there. Top value - but hard to get into; try now!

Reviews.Title: “Ready for Rive Gauche?”
Reviews.Author: bopeltzman
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to experience the Left Bank. Hemingway stayed across the street and wrote "A Moveable Feast" that talks about his experiences in the neighborhood. Get up early and stroll to one of the many cafes where you can sip cafe au lait and watch the school kids scurrying to school and the shopkeepers washing down the sidewalks in front of their businesses before opening. We had a very nice, large room (#217) with a curtain that you could use to close off the sitting area from the bedroom. Almost felt like a suite. Two windows to look out over the roof tops of Paris. The owner was very friendly (even waved to us one day) but you usually deal with the staff who were friendly and very patient and helpful. They will be glad to give you a cork-screw and wine glasses for the bottle you discovered at the local wine shop. The hotel is halfway between two Metro stops. One runs north-south and the other runs east-west so you can get anywhere in the city easily. It's also about 1 or 2 blocks from a 2000 year old Roman Forum that is now a place to watch the kiddies run around instead of gladiators trying to kill each other. For $119 Euros, I don't think you can do much better. We didn't miss having a TV but a 'frig. would have been nice. No A/C but we didn't need it in September anyway. We skipped the 8 Euro coffee and bread and I just went to the patisserie (1 block up the street) for fresh croissants, then next door to the charcuterie for a selection of quiches (which they will warm for you), then a couple of doors down to the market for orange juice and yogurt and fruit for a lunch snack. Then back to the room for a great breafast for about 3+ Euros/person. Would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is on my mind.”
Reviews.Author: JJGordon54
Reviews.Content: I can tell you the accomodation, location and people were charming, warm and helpful from the maid on up. The front gates secured by electronic swipes opening up to the cobblestone courtyard adorned by the colours of the garden was a welcoming site each day. The Parisiene room was quaint, yet roomy, the windows opening into the laneway, the quiet surroundings all made our retreat as perfect as we anticipated. The neighbouring bistro, cafes were plentiful in local and International offerings. The Patisseries we still long for. Downhill to the Seine, short jaunt to the Metro, passes delivered right to the hotel made transportation easy at the Museums, Metro and Buses. Concierge arranged a fabulous night at the Lido. The only surprize turned out to ba a taxi who happened on our luggage at the gate hurried us away and charged us 52 Euro instead of the 30 we had expected. We arranged for a shuttle to the airport and thought he was it. Rather unfortunate but Paris and le Grande Ecole immerge triumphant in our magical whimsical Anniversary holiday to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Grandes Ecoles - a left bank gem”
Reviews.Author: platypus854
Reviews.Content: We have been guests at this charming hotel on many occassions, most recently August 2004. We are always welcomed like family members and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Clean, comfortable, pretty rooms. Great location. Extremely reasonable rates. We particularly enjoy the breakfasts in the courtyard garden. Easy to make reservations via the net, but don't leave it till the last minute! This delightful hotel is our Parisian home away from home, and we have shared the experience with our children and grandchildren, who love it just as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Breakfast in the charming courtyard and walking distance from St. Germaine, The Isles, The Bridges and the Seine. Some body odor in the pillows was upsetting but our room with bath was spacious and the stay very enjoyable. Staff was great in dealing with two strangers with no French from reservation to daily needs.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Rachel123
Reviews.Content: All rooms are not of the same standard - watch out, we ended up in a claustrophobic strange shaped, slightly shoddy one with an unclean bathroom in the main building. Fortunately we didn’t spend much time in there, we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, ideally located, good value”
Reviews.Author: JVBull
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be charming, ideally located, comfortable, and spotlessly clean. Our room was of good size, very comfortable bed (two twins pushed together and made up as one), and opened on to the hotel's quiet courtyard. We were there the last week in June so lack of AC was not an issue. We appreciated no TV. Hotel staff was a bit distant but always courteous. The neighborhood is ideal, quiet, full of university students and places to eat and sit, and away from the hustle and tourists down by the Seine. Yet one can walk to Notre Dame in 10 minutes, and the subway in 5 minutes. Returning to this neighborhood for dinner each night was a relief and joy. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, excellent staff, but make sure you don't get a small room!”
Reviews.Author: gutenberg55
Reviews.Content: The location on the Left Bank is excellent, the lobby and rooms are clean and well-maintained. The staff is helpful and will speak English or French (and was tolerant of mine). We had a nice view of the garden. The experience would have been a superior one if the room had been larger. As it was, the "double" bed was not much larger than an American single bed (let alone a queen) and there was not enough space to store two medium-sized suitcases flat. So I would hesitate to go back unless I could be sure of getting a significantly larger room. If you are an American who needs more protein than a Continental breakfast can supply, breakfast sandwiches and coffee are available at a neighborhood boulangerie for less money than the hotel's standard breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the OJ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mother for two nights before an apartment we rented became available. We had no problem with check in. We had the building across from the main building. It overlooked the front patio. My mother, in her early 70's wasn't doing well from jet lag. She felt BAD. I went looking for some tea for her and they built me a little tray with hot tea on it for her. It was very nice. The rooms was fresh, clean, small, but lovely. We were glad we were there for a short time, because although perfect for lovers, it was too close of quarters for me and my mom. The bf was very continental, but skimpy. The coffee WONDERFUL. I saw someone with juice and I asked for some and found I was charged $4 for each glass of OJ. (apparently, juice was not included in the price of BF) It was very good juice. Mom had two glasses. This was after already paying a pretty substantial fee for BF, and thought this was over the top. We had problems with a calling card we had purchased. The advice they gave me didn't work. Apparently I had been sold the wrong type of card and so... just lost my money. They didn't intervene in any way to help. So I have mixed reviews. Most important, my mom had a problem with the steep hill from the metro to the room. After trekking around Paris and up and down stairs, she just hated facing that steep climb back to the room. The room DID have lift, which she appreciated. All in all, it was nice for the price. Not recommended for anyone with a bad knee or with any disability unless you taxi in.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CristianaSantos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Ecoles in honeymoon last November. The hotel is perfect! The location is great, the staff very nice and the garden seems like an oasis when you cross the gate. It does not have a TV for the rainny days, but with Paris outside nobody will think about that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our 30th wedding anniversary in May after much researching of hotels on the internet. The hotel lived up to all expectations - and the location was perfect being only a short walk from both the Cardinal Lemoine metro and Notre Dame and the River Seine. Our first floor room in the garden building overlooked a very pretty courtyard where we enjoyed a bottle of wine before going out to one of the many nearby restaurants for our evening meal. We only had breakfast once at the hotel preferring to walk to the Rue Mouffetard nearby where we enjoyed an excellent breakfast at the Cafe Mouffetard. We would definitely stay at the hotel again when we next visit Paris which hopefully will be very soon!
